reviewText: I had several reservations ordering this phone after reading so many of the poor reviews. Although Amazon LLC sells the item, it's over one-third more than other sellers. Before buying, I contacted Amazon customer service and they said I would get a full, no questions asked refund if the phone did not work with my SIM card if I used either Amazon or an Amazon Fulfillment seller. So I went for such a seller, less than Amazon LLC but not the rock-bottom cheapest.What I received appeared to be in brand new condition: the box was sealed, and so were all the bags inside. The charger has a US plug but can be used overseas. The battery appeared to be new too, and after being charged under three hours held it for over 36 hours.  The phone was unlocked, but T-Mobile branded. It worked with both my T-Mobile SIM and a UK (English) pay-as-you-go SIM.I wanted a quad band, unlocked GSM cell phone for overseas travel.  This phone fits the bill, and the aesthetics are nice.  Folded, the phone is quite pocketable.  Open, the size is easy enough to manage.  Both the exterior and huge interior screens are color.  The lighted keypad looks like "Tron" in its use of a blue florescent design.The owner's manual is quite skimpy and cheaply printed as other reviewers suggest. But I was able to download the full manual as a PDF from Motorola's web site.  The supplied manual is small enough to keep in a wallet while travelling, though.I didn't try sending an MMS, but received one or two of SMS advertisements, so text messaging works.  If you want a phone for overseas travel that will work in almost any country with a local SIM card, consider this one.  As long as you buy from Amazon LLC or use a seller with Amazon Fulfillment, you a) probably will not have any problems and b) will at least get a no questions asked refund with the seller paying return shipping if what you receive does not work as described.
title: Motorola RAZR V3 Unlocked Phone with Camera, and Video Player - U.S. Version with Warranty (Black)

In addition, this charger has 850MA Output and is genuine Motorola OEM of the finest quality. And this charger works as well in older HTC phones with mini USB ports and other phones with mini USB ports. It was worth every penny and after I received and tested this out, I threw away my cheapie generic mini USB chargers! Oh, and one more thing I will add: As a suggestion: Don't bother with non OEM chargers, these are cheapies and not made well and usually have a low output and input rating and some just have as low as 400MA output - 500MA output about 1/2 of what the phones need. reviewText: Like I said in another review: All mini USB's do not work for every charger, for every cell phone.Case in point: I have my GPS with its car charger (USB). I figured that since my newer phone had a mini USB charge, this "USB to Mini USB Adapter" will work for my phone (Sanyo Katana LX). Not! They must designed the power pins anyway they felt like, because a mini USB power charger is NOT universal. I hear that by Oct. 2010 (in Europe at least) all cell phone will have a universal mini USB charging port - you should be able to charge them thru your computer and you'll never will have to throw your old charger away, just because you got a new phone! Or you can charge your phone with your buddy's charger...no problem. A very sensible, bright idea I should say!But we are not there yet!THE GOOD PART: The exchange went very smoothly, and the people involved were helpful and understanding!!

reviewText: Because I "hate" wires dangling from my windshield, I have my GPS hard-wired through my headliner. Over the past 12 years, every new Tom-Tom I bought used the Mini-USB, until now! This adapter allows me to connect my new Tom-Tom, which now uses Micro-USB connectivity, to my old Micro-USB power lead. My one concern, which was not addressed in the ad for this item, was that it might supply power but not transfer data. Well, no need to be concerned. This adapter allows perfect data transfer. There is no difference in the operation of my Tom-Tom GO Live whether I use the power cord supplied or use my old power lead with this adapter. This is a high quality product at a very "value friendly" price. Also, this adapter makes a very secure connection. I make this statement because once installed, I had to "stuff" all the wire up into the headliner through a small opening. The connection stayed tight and continues to operate perfectly. Thanks Motorola. Super item!

reviewText: I have purchased (usually from my cellular provider or retailer for about $1) and used several of these adapters with various devices over the past several years and EVERY single one of them has eventually "failed".  The average life expectancy of these adapters, for me, has been about 6 to 9 months.  After the initial "failure" I've found that I can wrap or coil the cord around the device to maintain the angle or pressure on the connection - which works about 80-90% of the time.  I have no experience on how long this "fix" lasts, as the inconvenience annoys me into replacing the defective adapter after a short time.I have not tested the data throughput rates with these, so I have no comments on that... other than that they do allow you to transfer data via USB.Overall, these have been good adapters... when they work - especially for the $1 each price I paid.  I just hesitate spending more than $1 each on these adapters given the short life I've experienced with them.  In my experience these adapters should rate the same life-expectancy as the Mini-USB cables they are attached to (or any other data cable for that matter... rated in years, not months).
title: Motorola RAZR2 V8 / V9 EMU / Micro USB Adapter [OEM] SKN6252

reviewText: Simple! Basically, it can be paired with any BT transmitters (iPod, Mac & PC) easily, which is good, right?! Sound quality - heh! Good, not great, that's for sure! I wasn't expecting much, to be honest. I really like all those sound and light notifications. Nice facade and wi-fi range, too! I wouldn't use it to listen to your music in particular, but it works just fine for live radio shows and TV broadcasts, where you really don't give a damn about sound quality.
title: Motorola MOTOROKR EQ5 Bluetooth Portable Speaker

reviewText: UPDATE:  This review was based on my purchase price of $29.  It's value decreased considerably if the price is much higher.This has about the same footprint as my iPhone.  It's about a fraction of it's weight.  Build quality is excellent.  The speaker contains a rechargeable battery and there is a clear indication of when it needs to be charged and when the charging has been completed.  More on the charger and that "clear indication" in a bit.Pairing with my iPhone was immediate right out of the box.  I turned on the speaker, went to the bluetooth discover screen on my phone, it picked up the unpaired device, I entered the super-secret code number (0000), and it was done.Sound quality is good (for this type of speaker).  The sound is clear, there is very little (but at least some) bass, and it doesn't sound tinny.  I bought it for playing background music on the deck and it's certainly clear enough and there's definitely enough volume for that.The description implied and it should be clearly stated that in addition to working as a speaker this also works as a speaker phone and can also pass voice commands to the phone.  In fact it works just like the Motorola S9 headset except that forward and reverse don't seem to work with my iPhone4 (and it's much more difficult to wear as a headset).The AC charger is universal (at one end); it accepts 100-240V at 50/60 Hz.Now for the minor issues:There's a very bright and annoying light that insists on flashing when music is playing. According to the (well written) manual it means there's either a call or music on standby.  Near as I can tell there isn't.  This can be easily "fixed" with electrical or duct tape.  :)If you want to charge the speaker from your laptop or USB charger you need to supply your own mini-USB (laptop/charger end) to micro-USB (speaker end) cable.Minor annoyances aside, this speaker is a good value.  You can share music from your mobile device at good volume and reasonable fidelity while keeping said mobile device on your person.  I haven't tried the wired connection and frankly if I was looking for that kind of speaker I'm sure there are plenty available that would cost less while providing the same sound quality.BTW, I feel that honest, effective reviews can take the place of first-hand experiences that are lacking in online shopping. I've always appreciated the help I've received from other reviewers and work hard to return the favor as best as I can.  I hope you found this review helpful and if there was anything you thought was lacking or unclear leave a comment and I'll do what I can to fix it.
title: Motorola MOTOROKR EQ5 Bluetooth Portable Speaker

reviewText: Pros1)  Compact design.Cons1)  Sound quality is scratchy.2)  Speakerphone function does not allow to answer incoming calls suing skype.
title: Motorola MOTOROKR EQ5 Bluetooth Portable Speaker

reviewText: I do a lot of PowerPoint presentations to groups of about 30 people and wanted a speaker for the few audio clips in my presentations that I could easily carry with me without having two speakers and a power supply, so I bought this speaker. It works well and does have louder sound than the laptop speakers, but not quite enough for what I was looking for, so I experimented with it as a speaker phone for my DROID and that's where it really shines. Good value and great sound for a small group of three or four on a conference call and the noise canceling microphone works great. I carry it in my computer bag all the time to use for impromptu conference calling. But, I bout this for $29 and now I see it's listed at $50. I wouldn't have bought it for $50.Meantime, I'm still experimenting with a solution for the PowerPoint presentations. I'm trying Grandmax Tweakers which are quite small & compact, self-powered, and produce a bit louder sound.
title: Motorola MOTOROKR EQ5 Bluetooth Portable Speaker

reviewText: This is a nicely designed, well-constructed, handy and effective wireless speaker, its built-in rechargeable battery adding to its usefulness.  I've mated it with an iPod Touch while listening to a downloaded audible text on long car trips.  Music is a wholly different story.  I'm no fan of the bass-heavy recordings, but I still appreciate being able to identify the pitches of an acoustic bass not to mention the touch and tone of individual players.  I'm afraid this little speaker is simply incapable of accessing the lower regions of the frequency range.Without moving too far out of this price range, the audible difference between the EQ5 and EQ7 is night and day when it comes to music.  In fact, the Motorola EQ7 is one of the most overlooked, underrated giants among personal wireless speakers.  Otherwise, the Logitech Z515 and Creative D100 are worthy, if notably larger sized, speakers.  Also, some speakers-- especially those made by Sprach and Tanqa--are not only wireless but produce more bass and at a lower price than the EQ5 (though you'll have difficulty finding one that has the pocket-sized compactness of the EQ5).
title: Motorola MOTOROKR EQ5 Bluetooth Portable Speaker

reviewText: Got this yesterday and have been using it ever since.  I bought it specifically to pair with my HTC Hero and have music anywhere.  It works like a dream.  It has good volume and amazing (for its size) sound quality.  And the price was great.  I get 6-7 hours on a full charge.  I am a fan!!
title: Motorola MOTOROKR EQ5 Bluetooth Portable Speaker

reviewText: Sync with iphone 4 without any problems.  BT link only a very short distance like 2 ft (not sure if this is the norm), but was hoping to be able to move speaker from room to room while the iphone stays in one place.Please, do not expect the sound quality to be like your $5000 stereo system, you will be very disappointed.  Sound quality is like a low end logitech computer speaker.  Its better than your laptop speakers and better than the iphone's built in speakers.  Controls work great and was able to make and receive phone calls with it.
title: Motorola MOTOROKR EQ5 Bluetooth Portable Speaker

reviewText: I have spent about an hour researching what would be the best in-car speakerphone for my Samsung Captivate phone. Based on comments, I have decided to order one. After one week of using:Cons:1. Hey, it does a good job as soon as you synchronized your phone (easy process)2. The sound quality is good3. The sound volume is acceptable (I was able to clearly hear the voice while was driving in my SUV). When I played a music, I could regulate the volume on my phone, and it was amplified to a quite loud sound.4. To answer the phone - all you have to do is to press the button on the top of a speakerphone. If you listen the music (it was an audio book in my case), if somebody is calling, you can hear the beeps while the music volume is automatically goes down.5. When you have the sync, the green light is slowly blinking, so you know it's in the operating mode.6. Acceptable, compact size7. Lithium battery that can be recharged (I have also purchased the car adapter with compatible USB port)8. Price comparing to competitors' prices.Cons:1. For instance, today I had to turn on/off my unit two times until the green light started blinking (a sync problem or just a minor "misunderstanding"?)2. The power button is shifted left-right to turn on and off, but the button itself is very thin,  and without fingernail it's difficult to change the switch position. It's annoying. I would prefer a touch-style.3. There is no clip to adjust it on your car visor. I believe, this device was designed more for playing music as an external speaker for bluetooth enabled devices. The audio input confirm this. I am not sure I will be using at all.Overall, I like the speakerphone as it does a job. In fact, I have ordered one more for my daughter. I was thinking about giving it 3 stars but then decided to add one more.
title: Motorola MOTOROKR EQ5 Bluetooth Portable Speaker

reviewText: I bought two of these as backup work chargers for our Droids.  The ones we received do charge the Droid fine, though at about half the rate of the OEM wall charger that Motorola included with the Droid.  Going from 25% to 100% takes about 4 hours, versus about 2 with the OEM charger.A couple things struck me about the charger compared to the OEM model.  The cable is very thin, though longer, which is nice for out of reach plugs.  The build quality is mediocore, and definitely below that of the OEM charger.My conclusion is the chargers work and are a good value compared with buying from the Verizon store.  If you are looking for a quicker charge, it probably is worth getting the OEM model that came with your Droid.  But for a backup charger it's hard to beat the value on this offering.One other suggestion.  If you already have a Motorola mini USB charger for an older phone, you can simply buy the OEM mini to micro adapter (about a 2" cable) sold by Amazon.  Works for both wall and home chargers.

reviewText: I bought one of these for my Kindle Fire HD 8.9", at first just to save wear and tear on the micro-USB power port, but then discovered it made reading while plugged-in MUCH more comfortable because it dresses the power cord down the side of the Kindle.That's instead of the normal way of the charging cord just sticking out at right angles which is awkward and also a disaster in the making.This little gadget even has a nice little strain relief lanyard which loops over a corner of my case and which helps greatly to avoid undue strain on my Kindles port.Seems like a simple thing but it's one of those helpful and valuable little additions.Also as a bonus compared to some others I've tried it's very much 100% high quality Motorola.*** Ignore the description that it's for Motorola's RAZR2 V8 (that's what Motorola specifically makes it for),  as it fits any micro-USB device such as the Kindles, which is actually all of them.
title: Motorola Micro USB SKN6258 Adapter for RAZR2 V8 Q9m V9

reviewText: I bought this for use with my Droid Maxx in an Otterbox Case.  It has 2 uses for me.My first reason was wanted a short extension cable for use with a Meenova Micro SD Card Reader as Droid Maxx doesn't have a on board micro SD Card slot and have to use the Meenova as a removable bay.  I needed this because the Meenova reader would not fit with an Otterbox case installed.My second reason it takes the plug and angles the power cord down when I use my phone as a GPS. I don't have to worry about the straight cord damaging my charging/data port on my phone or distorting the car charger cord by bending it from the weight of the cord and the bouncing of a vehicle.This should be given with all Motorola phones, but well worth the money spent on the item. It's a must have!!!

reviewText: Useful item to have if your phone port is on the side of your phone.I was sick of not being able to rest my phone(HTC Evo V(Evo 3D)) in its Otterbox case to use it as a kickstand with the power plug in. some apps will not flip the display if you flip the phone over(Trust me I tried that first). Even though it doesnt lock into place in the holster with the right angle adapter, I am able to rest it in place to use it. It even fits easily with my Otterbox case being super thick around the phone, which was a concern for me. It has enough distance on the part that plugs into the phone to reach down in, around, and easily fits between the plastic port opening to reach down to the port.I am planning on getting a portable USB powerpack and this will work great when the phone is in my pocket and plugged into it.Motorola logo is on the micro USB male and micro USB female ends. Made of good quality. The 1 inch cable in the center is pretty thick and yet still very flexible. you can bend the cable any direction you want, Even kink together if you wanted to with ease.Both ends are VERY snug. Never have to worry about the cable coming loose, But the cable string to hold it if it does come unplugged on the one end is nice to have.Overall length of this adapter is probably somewhere around 3-3 1/2 inches.Very happy with this adapter. Will buy again if ever needed.

reviewText: I purchased this bluetooth and it would not charge.  I emailed the company and they re sent me another one and it wouldnt charge either.  i purchased the same blue tooth from another online company and it would not work either,  so now i am having to go through motorolla.
title: Motorola H15 Noise Canceling Bluetooth Wireless Headset

reviewText: I had to return this item because I received too many complaints from people on the other end of the line.  I wanted it to work because of the small size and flip shut down but it had to go.

reviewText: Turning off / on when the bottom is flipped down is awesome. Eventually the battery dies - I've been through a couple of these - but at least they're affordable. I keep at least three of them connected to my phone in each car and office.
title: Motorola H15 Noise Canceling Bluetooth Wireless Headset

reviewText: Compared to my old bluetooth that I never used because people could never understand me, it is much better.  It does actually block most noise in the background.  My issue is that I like to have my windows down on the freeway when it's 80deg or less.  With my windows up and the radio on medium while driving on the freeway people can hear me clearly but once I roll down my windows are turn on my air condition on full blast people only hear my voice breaking up.  So it only does half of what it says, I've heard other people say it works for them even in the wind but apparently not for everyone. I'm a bit disappointed.  At least my old bluetooth allowed me to listen to my music while exercising but that one a little more expensive then this one.
title: Motorola H15 Noise Canceling Bluetooth Wireless Headset

reviewText: Though when this headset works it is fine audio and comfortable to wear, I do not recommend it because it does not hold a charge for very long. Previous headsets that I have owned have lasted at least a week with only one hour a day use on average. This one requires charging every other day.
title: Motorola H15 Noise Canceling Bluetooth Wireless Headset

reviewText: I like the style of this headset but I have had to purchase two of these.  The first one barely lasted past the first year before breaking, so I am not sure about the quality of these.  They seem to have gotten cheap on the ear pieces now as they are proned to breaking easily or getting caught on something in your pocket and getting flung out of it, which I have done before.
title: Motorola H15 Noise Canceling Bluetooth Wireless Headset

reviewText: I got this to replace my Plantronics Voyager 510. I found the Plantronics over-the-ear piece to be too bulky, always pushing the top of my ear far away from my head. Also, I found the Plantronics to be uncomfortable for long periods of time. However, the boom mic was superior. It picked up the voice very easily and clearly at the other end. The Motorola does not pick up my voice unless I hold it firmly against the side of my face, pointing to the mouth. [The boom tends to swing away from the face.] I tried all of the ear fittings hoping I would find one that more securely held it in place, to no avail. It is more comfortable for me to wear, but inferior regarding its functionality.
title: Motorola H15 Noise Canceling Bluetooth Wireless Headset

reviewText: Fitment is near impossible and the thing will not stay on my head. Sound quality is average at best. Plus, it completely plugs your ear so you hear nothing out of that ear. Really sorry I bought this, and getting something else.

reviewText: This battery looks just like the photo and says it is a RIM Blackberry, but it will not hold a charge.  Fully charged, it does not even last eight hours. The battery I am replacing was made in Japan and after years of use,it is actually still better than this new made in China battery.  It's not worth any amount of money - don't buy it.
title: BlackBerry Standard Battery 9000 Bold

reviewText: For the price it serves the purpose.  Will last a day with little usage.  Needed a battery for on non-used blackberry for traveling overseas.  I give it 5 starts for working but take away 2 for amount of time it holds a charge.  For this price you could buy a couple.

reviewText: I guess I was lucky, mine was OEM, or appeared to be. Fit well, worked just fine, solved the problem with a Bold that wouldn't charge anymore.  Even if it wasn't OEM, I could recommend this for the price, for sure.
title: BlackBerry Standard Battery 9000 Bold

reviewText: First impression that you get is worth a thousand words, right? So when the package the battery comes in says "BlackBerry Standard Battery 9000 Bold New"--- I think that means new, not almost new, not a take out new, not sorta new, not it was new at some point in its life new... but NEW. With that said, the contacts are dirtier than my original 3-year old battery, the case is scratched like someone played hockey with it and every other battery I have ever purchased was semi charged when I got it--- this one was not. The charge state of the battery does not bother me, the other definitely does.The only thing they have going for them so far was that it shipped quickly and I got it when I was supposed to. As far as the actual product that will either take it down to 1-star if it turns out to be a used and bad battery that will go back to them for a full refund or remain at 3-starts if it works like new. I can't go higher than 3-stars as right out of the gate as it was not clean and shiny new as it should have been.This is the third smartphone battery that I have bought on Amazon and the first one that was not as it was supposed to be. My reviews are usually positive and as long as it works as it is supposed to I give it full credit. I should know by Christmas if it is good or bad as I heavily use my Blackberry and know exactly how it is supposed to react.Jan 2012 update. After using it for a number of days, even though the case looks like it is well used, it does work much better than my last battery. So for this one--- 3-start it will stay and it should carry me over until I get my new Blackberry in the coming months.
title: BlackBerry Standard Battery 9000 Bold

reviewText: I would recommend this headset to anyone tired of uncomfortable ear buds and those damned wires.I read all of the negative reviews before reading all of the positive reviews. If any of the negative issues come up, I'll deal with them at that time. Most were from abuse. A large majority of owners love them. No electronic device should get wet or be dropped on the ground as so many neg. reviews complained about.Syncing was almost instant. The sound and fit is wonderful compared to the Jensen Bluthooth set I'm replacing. Sound is not quite like my Bose QC15s but really good! They stay put on my ears in most all situations. The controls are laid out very well- Like an old iPod without the "touch wheel" volume control. The battery life is strong. It varies according to use but it runs from 6-9 hours right now. I love the look too.
title: Motorola S305 Bluetooth Stereo Headset w/ Microphone (Black) - Retail Packaging
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: Pros -a) Easy to use. When you switch it on, it makes a lovely welcome sound. When the battery is low, it makes a different sound in-ears and when you switch it off or when the battery dies out it makes a certain sound to let you know what's happening.b) Build quality is good, it's very easy to set up. There is a charging light which is red when charging and green when the battery is full. Even when I'm not using this bluetooth it's good to carry around like semi-earmuffs.c) Battery life is good, not great. Five hours on a single charge with the volume at full.d) My blackberry can me in my living room and i can be in the bathroom with the door shut and it will work. I can be in the kitchen and this will work superbly.e) This works very well both with my blackberry and my iPod touch 2G.f) Excellent for the gym. I can run on the treadmill or be on the cross trainer or simply weight train.Cons -Although it is near-perfect for listening to music, this device disappoints when you're talking to someone. People have complained of my voice being sketchy and radio like. I cannot use this when I'm lying down because it is very uncomfortable even if you put a pillow underneath your neck. The buttons on the controller are confusing.Very satisfied with the product. The price is excellent too. I have about five or six wired headphones I use only when my bluetooth is out of battery.

reviewText: These work. Pair quickly and easily and sound quality is good.However, I am disappointed in the build of these headphones. They are made of cheap plastic. All of my phones have been Motorolas: Droid 2, Droid 2 Global, Droid X, and Droid X2. Before that, is was the Motorola Razr and Krazr. The reason that I stick with Motorola is that they have been very dependable for me. These headphones are not up to par.I could easily snap these in half by stepping on them or if one of the kids were to get ahold of them, they'd be goners for sure. I would feel unsafe wearing these outside, around the pool, or even just in my car traveling with them to hotels and such. I will only use these at home due to the poor build.Step it up, Motorola. It is a common assumption that a full bluetooth headset should sound better than a one piece bluetooth. However, my Motorola Finiti has better sound quality than these. I would recommend looking elsewhere or try out the Motorola Finiti. Great sound quality for music and puts this product to shame. Step it up, Motorola, and don't cheapen down your brand name that I have came to know and love.Based on the reviews, it appears that I am in the minority as far as being disappointed by these but I'm always totally honest in my reviews and I was honestly disappointed by this headset.Motorola FINITI Bluetooth Headset - Motorola Premium Packaging

reviewText: I was looking for a wireless solution to listen to music at the gym with my Itouch because I grew weary of earbud wires getting tangled up.  Based on the reviews here, the S305's seemed like an economical solution to try.The headphones charge very quickly, in about two hours or so.  Pairing on my Itouch was very simple.  I simply turned on Bluetooth, searched for devices, and was easily paired with the heaphones.The sound quality is certainly decent.  I am not an audiophile, I am just looking for basic listening quality to get me through my workout.  The bass response of these headphones are pretty decent, and overall I think the music quality is higher than what I was getting with my Creative earbuds.  The headphones turn off and on via a small power switch on the right cup, and there are two volume controls, up and down.  The buttons are pretty small, so I use the Itouch to control volume.I didn't find these headphones as flimsy as some of the reviews here indicate.  They are light and flexible, and I wouldn't really want them any heavier than they are now because they wouldn't be comfortable.The only issue I have is the fact that it is difficult to know when they are powered on and off.  It is not a big deal, and something I am still getting used to, but the headset would benefit from a clear power on and power off light.  It's possible that it's there and I am missing it, but if so it's not very visible.With these headphones selling in the low thirty dollar range as of this writing, I can't find much to complain about.  They sound good, seem to be well built, and offer a decent wireless solution.  The range is also pretty good - I accidently forgot my Itouch on a machine at the gym and wandered a good 30 feet before realizing I had left it behind because the music was still playing.  I also like these around the house to also listen to music.  You can't underestimate how much more convenient it is to listen to music without annoying wires.In the end, these are a decent solution and I am pleased with the quality and the price I paid for them.
title: Motorola S305 Bluetooth Stereo Headset w/ Microphone (Black) - Retail Packaging
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I got this headset to use primarily for walking and moderate workouts. I was a little skeptical to go with an over the ear style after being used to ear buds. I didn't think the sound would compare. I am very happy with the sound from this headset. Sound level is plenty loud. Good range of highs/lows. Bass quality will vary for me somewhat but that really is attributed to the original quality of the MP3 and not the headset. It never sounds bad, some songs just sound better.I paired this set with my Motorola Electrify. This would be a Motorola Photon to any of you Sprint customers out there. Pairing was simple. As long as I have Bluetooth turned on with my phone, the set connects automatically when turned on. My phone is compatible with the advanced track, pause, play features. This is AWESOME. I agree sometimes the volume button can be hard to figure out up or down by feel but you can tell by the pitch of the beeps which way you are going. If you are headed the wrong direction it's pretty easy to correct.For me, my right front pant pocket seems to be the best place for my phone. I experience the least amount of cut out here.  This seems to get worse if I turn my head one direction more then the other. Now depending on the material of my pants I may not have any cut out at all. Also if I simply hold the phone in my hand I don't have any cut out. Some may not mind that but I like hands free. Not sure if this is from my phone or the receiver on the set. I have my phone paired with my sound bar and I can venture around my house pretty well without cut out. But in the headsets defense I usually do not have the phone in a pocket here.I was not expecting very good call quality so when I ordered this it was strictly for music. To my surprise it has great call quality. I think the mic is pretty sensitive so I would agree in a loud scenario it won't filter out much. In a normal setting no one can tell I'm using a Bluetooth device. I was very impressed with this. The headset makes noise when you have an incoming call so you can hear that if it's on. What I like is my phone still rings like normal so I can just throw the headset on when I want it and don't have to worry about missing a call.So here are the things I don't like that holds this at 4 stars for me.-While this headset is very light, I would not wear this thing for an extended period of time, such as all day at work. My ears get sore if I wear this thing for hours at a time. I'm good for a couple hours at most. Maybe that's just me. I don't like wearing the simple over the ear hook style Bluetooth ear pieces in general for this reason. So it's not just this device.-If you are going to be doing a lot of laying down or resting your head back, this style of headset is going to make that more challenging. You can re-position the headset to overcome this but it takes a bit of adjusting.-Ear pads will probably become pretty gross over time. I've been using this thing for about a month now and it's had some pretty good sweaty workouts to deal with. The pads are still in great shape, not discolored and have no foul smell about them but I'm sure overtime this will change. They may be challenging to clean after extended use.Overall I am very happy with this headset. I love the ability to be hands-free and wireless. If this set is not your cup of tea I would recommend the LG ear bud style with the neck piece. That was my next purchase if I didn't like this unit. This one was a bit cheaper and the LG unit has wires running from the neck piece to the ears with the buds. Again I wanted wirless and and didn't want to deal with buds falling out. If you are an all day wearer though, I would take a look at that set over this one.

reviewText: LOVE IT! Serves as wireless music headseat or Bluetooth phone headset, simultaneously. Very light.  Great sound and music listening quality.  Buying one for my brother-in-law for Christmas! reviewText: I wanted to give this product 5 stars because even though there are a couple of respectable drawbacks I still use them a lot. 3.5 stars would be more accurate, I think...I listen to a lot of music and I listen to it most of the day while at work.  My tastes are mixed.  Everything from Motzart to Steve Roach (ambient) to Rush (progressive rock) to pop (tons of 80's 90's).  I wanted wireless music from my DroidX2 phone which is what I use.The Good:  The electronics work well.  Pretty darn good sound quality but I have a pair of $10 ear buds that have a better bass sound than these.  Even so, the sound quality is easily acceptable unless you are really into hearing the slightest instrumental nuances in your music.  I'm very happy with the sound.The ability to use this product for a phone headset is fantastic.  I mean it's really good.  Incoming voice is very clear and I have yet to hear a complaint about my transmitions.  I really like that the caller's voice is in both of my ears.  Absolutely no compaints as it does exactly what it is supposed to do.Works great with my laptop after using a Medialink - USB Bluetooth Adapter which fits right into my laptop's USB port.The bad:  The erganomics of these headphones are not as good as they should be.  It will hurt my head after while.  I can only assume that a smaller head would have less trouble.  I wear a 7 1/2 hat size which puts me at a med/small and I will get sore ears and/or a headache after wearing these for an hour or more.Having said that, it isn't so uncomfortable that I have to take them off until I've been at it for 3 or 4 hours.  I listen to them at work so that amount of time isn't always enough.  Of course ideally they wouldn't give me a headache at all.  ;-)The controls aren't so easy to use.  The raised + / - signs that indicate the up and down volumn buttons aren't very helpful.  I have just gotten used to 'knowing' where to press for volumn control.  The Skip Forward and Backward in playlist bottons don't seem to work with PowerAMP which is a very popular app I use on my Droid.Finally, the plastic loop that runs behind your neck and connects the two speakers WILL WARP IF LEFT IN THE SUN AND WILL NOT BEND BACK.  I left mine in the car for about an hour and the loop is now a bit more curved on one side than it should be making the headphones a tad less comfortable to wear.  I should have known but just didn't think about it.In conclusion I would recommend these headphones because they do what is advertised and aren't too uncomfortable to wear for my head size so long as it's not for more than 3 hours or so at a time.  Your mileage will likely vary by size comparison.

reviewText: I bought these to run with an 3rd gen iPod touch.  They are relatively comfortable, although I would definitely prefer an ear bud. reviewText: It seems that most Bluetooth headphones seem to suffer from the same problems, mainly signal strength and sound quality. I've purchased a no-name pair of bluetooth headphones before, and while I found the sound was alright, they were generally uncomfortable and just barely worked. So recently when I came across the Motorla S305 Bluetooth Stereo Headset on sale, I thought about Bluetooth support along with my new laptop and cell phone, both supporting A2DP (stereo audio) and AVRCP (remote control) and decided to go for it. I was rather pleased to find it had remote control support, as well as a MicroUSB charger - the same as my Motorola Droid. I've paired these headphones with both my laptop and my Droid, and found the sound quality to be excellent, and the signal strong even at a distance. The battery life was something I wasn't expecting - around six hours of play for only a couple hours charge. Definitely worth the purchase, for me. It's so nice to not be corded down.

reviewText: I bought these while they were on sale for my wife.  I have the older S9's and have had them for many years.  I still use them often every time I work out.  These are over the ear which she enjoys more.  The connection is very simple via bluetooth.  We had it connected to her iphone in a couple of minutes.  The music is pretty clear and can get decently loud (I listen to music pretty loudly).  The unit also can take and make calls.  When you press the phone button (assuming you have an iPhone with Siri) the siri bar comes up and you can make a call or do whatever you want via siri.  You can change tracks and increase/decrease volume via the side buttons as well.  It comes with a micro-usb charger to charge the unit.  I haven't used this pair much myself but the part that goes around your ears is similar to the S9's which I think is very comfortable.  The charge on these seem to last quite a while also but I am sure it will degrade since my older S9's usually need to be recharged after about an hour of use.

reviewText: I owned a Motorola S9 headset for almost three years. Excessive sweat from workouts finally completely fried the volume controls on the S9.I spent a little bit of time researching "bluetooth stereo headsets" with the following criteria in mind:1) it had to hold up against excessive sweating since it will be used mainly for exercising which primarily includes running, weight lifting and calisthenics. It also needs to stay on my head comfortably without falling off.2) it has to be wireless (Bluetooth), easy to operate, and work with my smartphone. I have an HTC Thunderbolt which is an Android phone.3) it has to be able to work primarily as a stereo headset. I don't really expect to take/place phone calls while working out, but it should be able to do that with ease as well.4) it has to be economical ($50 max spend especially if sweat breaks the product down)5) it has to have overwhelmingly good reviews from others who purchased the productI looked over a lot of products, both higher end and lower end. I read countless reviews that people left on different products and seller feedback as well. Although I enjoyed my Motorola S9, I was not inclined completely on buying another product from Motorola. But after a time-consuming review, I settled on this product which was $32 with free shipping for Prime customers.  After receiving the product, which came quickly, I evaluated the product and have the following comments:1) the product came with a mini USB which is the same power cord that my smartphone and other Bluetooth hands-free set for the car uses. (BONUS! An extra charger and my existing chargers will work on this same headset.)2) the headset charged up within an hour - to my amazement. it was very easy to connect to my smartphone, too, coming with simple instructions to understand.3) sound quality is excellent. one comment - if you are listening to music loudly, others will be able to hear what you are listening to - in case you get embarrassed listening to Rihanna while you are working out!4) control buttons are a little smaller to use, but I rate them as good nevertheless because they had no problem responding and controlling the songs or calls on the smartphone.5) volume control button falls in line with the above, but one thing I liked about it was that when you get to the loudest level, and keep pressing the volume button, it doesn't reset to the lowest volume level like my S9 did. Also, volume can be further controlled using your smartphone.6) placing/receiving calls was easy. the sound quality was very good, including what my callers said - that they were surprised I was using a headset which sounded like a regular phone conversation. I think the mic is on the earpiece, there is a little hole at the bottom of one earpiece, so it must be a sensitive mic. After hanging up, the music continued playing right where it left off, no problems there.7) finally, the headset itself is a lot more flexible than the S9. It feels more comfortable than the S9, even though it goes around the back of your head in the same manner. It has the ear wrap-arounds which make it feel snug and comfortable on your head as well. The even fit comfortably on my 4 year old daughter who picked them up and starting running around the house with them on her head!I recommend these headphones because it satisfied all of my criteria, and it appears to be a great value for the money. If you expect to sweat your brains out while working out, and want a pair of headphones that won't break down, then this is the right set to buy. The lower cost and greater comfort/flexibility than the S9 or S10 makes it another compelling reason to buy.

reviewText: I just used these for the first time at the gym last night. WOW, I have to say these really impressed me. The comfort, sound and ease of setup to my iPhone were great. They got a little buggy about a week ago, but I think becasue I didn't charge them for long enough. I left them for an overnight charge and now they work with no errors again. reviewText: I was looking for a blue tooth device for my iPhone when I saw all the positive reviews for the S305. This is a great headset that syncs up easily with my iPhone4 and my laptops. Since it is wireless, I am able to work out in the gym and leave my phone in my bag while I listen to music. It is great not having to worry about carrying my phone on my person and not having to worry about cords getting in the way. It allows you limited control of the iPod functions on your iPhone. The controls on the earpiece took a little getting used to at first, but I have no problem now. The sound is good and not so loud that it will bust your eardrums. Last night I made a telephone call using the headset and was really impressed with the sound clarity. My only gripe is that the plastic headband warps sometimes, but other than that, this headset rocks. I highly recommend it to anyone who works out and likes to listen to music without the hassle of headphone cords. Also, it is an excellent wireless headset for laptops.

reviewText: When the headphones are nearly fully charged they work pretty well.  Simple activate bluetooth on my phone, turn on the headphones, and hit play on the headphones and I'm off.  My completely enjoyment ends, however, when the headphones "connect" but nothing on them works, in this case I have to reset my bluetooth connection between the two devices by unpairing and repairing the connection.  Unfortunately this happens about every 5th time I use them.  On top of that the sound quality is certainly not magnificent with little to zero bass and should you have your phone/music player in the opposite pocket to the headphone's receiver, in which case you will enjoy the frequent dead pockets in the music where the connection fails.  30ft? I don't think so.  I believe this is caused by the movement of my pocket, however, because I can set my phone on my desk and walk across the room and into the hallway without being interrupted.  The good news is, however, that they are PERFECT for biking where you don't want a cord in the way, they're also superb for making calls as they have a push-to-talk feature built in which works rather well.  On top of that call quality is rather good, in the past using bluetooth headphones I was frequently asked if I was on speakerphone and told that it sounded like I was breaking up, however with these headphones I had essentially zero problems with hearing the person and zero problems with them hearing me.  Oh yea, and the battery life is no where NEAR advertized.  It's like 3 hours of constant use (highish volume though)Summary:  Good headphones that are not without their problems.  If your budget is limited go ahead and buy them, if you COULD spend 80 bucks on some good ones then probably get those instead.
title: Motorola S305 Bluetooth Stereo Headset w/ Microphone (Black) - Retail Packaging

reviewText: Problem 1 - I bought these because in the details it said it would pair with 2 devices at the same time. I followed the directions and paired it with my iPhone 4S and then turned them both off, turned the headphones back on and paired it with my iPad 2. I then turned everything off. I tried restarting everything and still had the same problem.Problem 3 - After wearing these for about 2 hours my ears were killing me, they were very uncomfortable!Needless to say I returned these the day after I got them.

reviewText: I've used several brands of Stereo Bluetooth headsets from Jabra to Plantronics to Motorola. I was mostly obsessed with getting ear bud style bluetooth headsets and did not want to give the over the ear ones a try. I thought they would get more sweaty at the gym or cause me to feel uncomfortable with the bulk but I was wrong!  These light weight S305's are fantastic.  The sound is about as good as bluetooth headsets can get. I do 45 minutes to an hour of weight training and 30-40 minutes of cardio in these and I often forget I'm wearing them.With my old ear bud style ones I would constantly have to re-adjust them during my workout. I would have a hard time skipping tracks and adjusting volume because the the buttons were so small and hard to use. With these S305's the button placement is excellent and easy to use and the only time I have to adjust them is when I do incline bench press but even that got easier to deal with after a few workouts.I have taken a few phone calls with these and those sound great too. The other party can hear me clearly and I can hear them clearly. I will say that if you are outside taking a phone call and there is a some wind the other party will hear the wind noise and it can become annoying on longer calls.  This is a minor complaint since I mostly use these for music and if I take a call with them I'm usually at home not outside.Overall I highly recommend these Motorola S305's. The price is excellent at $30-35 and they seem durable. I've been using them for over a month now and I will not go back to earbud style headphones again.QUICK TIP: If you sweat in them DO NOT charge them right away. When you get home let them sit for several hours (or overnight) before you charge them. Charging them after you sweat in them is a great way to fry the battery and burn them out.  The battery life is excellent and you should be able to get at least 3-4 workouts with them before they need charging.Edit: Well after 3.5 months the unit broke. The volume button stopped working on them. Too late to return them to Amazon but Motorola is going to replace them. I just have to pay to ship it back to them.  If the replacement breaks I will probably look to buy the Kinivo BTH220.  They seem sturdier than these Motorola's. I am a little disappointed that these don't cut out any outside noise at all (like zero noise cancelling). The foam pads barely touch my ears so I can hear all outside noise. The guy next to me was stomping as he ran on the treadmill and I could barely hear my own music.
title: Motorola S305 Bluetooth Stereo Headset w/ Microphone (Black) - Retail Packaging
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: After trying out about four different sets of earbuds (which either hurt my ears, made my ears ring or sounded tinny and cheap), I took a shot at these, figuring the sound couldn't be any worse, and the discomfort certainly couldn't.  If I were to like them, the wireless feature would be a bonus.  Having said all that, though, I was highly skeptical.  I expected weak sound, spotty bluetooth and about an hour of battery life, tops.  In fact, I kept all the original packaging pristine to prepare for their return.  I'm happy too say I was proven wrong on all counts.  They're quite lightweight and comfortable, for starters (though if you're wearing a hoodie or something high up on the back of your neck, they can be a bit clunky -- admittedly, this is nitpicking);  Stunningly, the sound is crisp with full bass that put every earbud I tried to shame;  battery life is a non-issue, as they last for hours on a single charge; and, most amazingly, the bluetooth feature is smooth as silk.  The only time I could get it to skip was when I was across my house with the phones from the actual music player -- and then it was still mostly uninterrupted.  While I obviously can't guarantee you'll have the exact same result and response, I can highly recommend these phones -- I've been really surprised and delighted -- and the ability to answer phone calls has been effortless (I use a Droid X) and something I hadn't even thought of.  I will say that the controls on the earphone are a bit tricky to master without looking at when you use them -- but I had 'em down after a few days' use.  Overall, a great product from Motorola that I'd eagerly recommend.
title: Motorola S305 Bluetooth Stereo Headset w/ Microphone (Black) - Retail Packaging

reviewText: i have a bluetooth motorola earpiece that is over 3 yrs old and still works like day one (one reason i gave this motorola product a try) i wanted a bluetooth stereo headset for the gym or sitting poolside while listening to music w/o the hassle of a cord. i do not like the in-ear style which is why i choose this style. it fits comfortably and i have found the sound to be excellent. it handles all ranges well. i do not listen at max volumes since i do not want to cause hearing damage. i can still hear things going on outside of these headphones which i prefer. the controls are on the right ear side. your options are north, south, east & west. it lets me pause, skip forward or backward on music tracks. if you are listening to music and the phone rings, it will pause the music. after your call, the music resumes. i had a 30 minute call with a friend and the sound was fine. i never mentioned that i was on this new toy and he never indicated that he could not hear me. it comes with a wall charger. you have to charge it out of the box and it will take a cpl hours. it also has an soft color light that glows red while charging. once it's green - you're good to go. the headband sticks out an inch from the back of your head. that is fine for me but if you are against a pillow it might need some adjusting. for the money, this is a great buy - quality sound & very fair price. i highly recommend for the casual user who doesn't want to spend a fortune.

reviewText: The only reason these headphones didn't get five stars is  because of the relatively cheap build quality, this comes with the price point but doesn't interfere with the integrity of the product. The headphones sit comfortable over the ear and with a little bit of manuvering, will fit on your ears with glasses. All the weight is carried on the ears which makes it so  these headphones don't bounce up and down (a characteristic oif many behind the neck headphones). The functionality of the controls are great though a direct push on the icons is needed to have the function correctly registered. The pairing process is effortless and the 'phones will last about 6 workouts before having to be recharged. The recharging takes about  45 minutes and the 'phones will probably last longer if you don't have the internal volume cranked up as I  do. Though i do this so I can simply control the volume from my iPhone. The sound quality was surprisinglky good, with many instruments coming through that I usually don't hear with inexpensive headphones. If you like bass in your music  these headphones will not dissapoint as the 30mm drivers provide nice bass. While not perfect in an audiophile sense these 'phones are great for the casual listener and more than adequate for gym use. A very satisfying purchase.

When used for calls clarity was generally quite good and people generally didn't know I was on a Bluetooth headset. I have some concerns about durability after the first pair died so quickly. The headphones generally linked reliably with a Galaxy Nexus and Motorola Triumph. I didn't track battery life too closely but it seemed about in line with the specs. Any questions just ask.

reviewText: I just got these headphones today and I have to say that I was expecting more. Don't get me wrong, they sound fine, good bass and the treble is not high, it is well balanced.What I don't like is that the stereo is not as wide as I thought it was going to be, since I own the regular headphones that came with my Galaxy Note 3 and they sound awesome, although the treble is higher with them, the sound I think is much clearer and wider.I also have a Plantronics Gamecom 780 with 7.1 sorround sound, and I think I am being unfair comparing them with any other not 7.1 capable headphones, but the sound they delivered are great, just wanted to tell that I consider the sound coming from the Note 3's are almost as good as them, just not so wide and with less bass, then this Motorola S305 are well balanced in sound but not as wide.They are a good choice for the price, I have not had any bluetooth headset before so I cannot compare them with any other, I am not an Audiophile so I don't go spending hundreds of dollars in these things since I basically use them while on the bus and at work.Overall, pretty good, the material is very classy, not fancy at all, they are smaller than I thought, they fit perfectly in my little head and although they don't eat your ears, they cover them well enough to stop the surrounding noise from being listened.At very high volume, they have a very little of distortion, but that may be because I tweaked the volume of my phone to be higher than normal and since you can make the volume go higher than what the phone can, it creates this bit of distortion.I have to try it with calls, I am not very social so I don't have lots of people calling me or I ever have so much of a necessity calling anyone, but I will give them a try.These headphones have a battery life of around 6.5 hours of constant audio playback, I am not sure about how long will it last for phone calls, in stand-by is said to last for days.It is a good device, it paired easily with my computer and Note 3, so there it has my 4 stars.I will be updating this review after trying a call.

reviewText: These things are awesome - I use them all day streaming music from about 8am to 9pm. Battery life is great. I have only ever heard them beep for low battery once and that was before i had broken the battery in. Now I put it on the charger when I go to bed and 4 hours later when I wake up they last me all day. They far exceeded my expectations in this field. I figured they'd be dead after about 6 hours - they over double that.For the most part, they are relatively comfortable but once in a while, the band does start to cut into my ears.It could be that they are turned to an odd position but 95% of the time it's not a problem.If you have ever worn the old Sony headphones with the same relative design - they do not have guards that keep them comfortably lifted and the plastic is thicker so it does take some getting used to.Ive never had a problem using these with my phone. In fact, they love each other.The button positions are easy to use and [imo] intuitive.They do have their own volume controls are operated separately from the device which is a plus.Connection has a wide range. I can leave my phone at my desk and remain connected in the bathroom approximately 40 feet away.At home, my phone stays in my bedroom and i have reception from all corners of my 1700 square foot house. Range is great.Some people with the iphone commented on the reciever cutting off if your body is in the way - I'm not sure if they increased the strength of the transmitter but it has never been a problem for me.In calls I'm told it sounds like I'm not even using a headset and the soundquality is great for both music and calls.I love them so much, 3 of my friends purchased them on my recommendation and every one loves them.---Edit 23 April 2013---Somewhere around a year into owning these the plastic began to inexplicably fray.Not a huge deal, but something to know. They still work FLAWLESSLY (sound great, still pair easily.) and I will love them til they fall apart, but I am looking for another set that is lighter weight as it is time to replace these.I guarantee these things do not disappoint. Very solid motorola product.
title: Motorola S305 Bluetooth Stereo Headset w/ Microphone (Black) - Retail Packaging
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I bought these headphones because they are bluetooth which means the wire wouldn't snag on the barbells when I work out and don't get in the way when I run.  So far, so good.  They are light and I can wear them comfortably for about 45 min to 1 hr, then they start to hurt the top of my ears a bit.  I take them off and reposition them, and I get used to it.  Overall though, they are pretty comfortable and you really don't notice them.The fit is good on the rest of my head (I'm 5'9", about 175 lbs) and I have no issues wearing them.They get pretty loud, but not loud enough to drown out everything around you in a very noisy environment.The music sounds pretty good.  I've spent a lot of time DJing in the past and have great headphones and cheap ones.  For me, these are just fine and pick up the tones quite nicely.Ratings (1=low, 5=highest)Comfort: 4Loudness:  4Cost:  4Ease of connection:  5fit:  5sound: 4I pad $40 on amazon, and they are good for workouts and running since they have no wires and they stay in place.  They can be a little uncomfortable on the ears after about 45 min, but you get used to it.NOTE:  I only used them with my ipod touch 2G, not a phone.  I tried them briefly with a BB bold, and they worked fine, but I had to unpair it then pair it again to use them with my ipod.I recommend them, you should get them, you won't be dissapointed.

reviewText: These are extremely clever headphones.  They cram many, many features into a tiny package.  They are, unfortunately poor on two key counts if you're interested in using them to listen to music.  The first is that the bluetooth feature for listening to music just didn't work well and was easily disrupted, either by moving around in relation to the source of the bluetooth broadcast or, when using my iPad or iPhone, if I were using any other apps on the device.The comfort of these headphones was also poor and the behind the neck placement irritating if I were sitting.  The headphones pinched too tightly on my head and the grip or tension was not adjustable.  After a relatively short time, the pressure on my ears was unacceptably painful.  The behind the head placement of the loop connecting the individual earpieces is nominally a good idea, but because the loop of the headset is fairly large, it sticks out behind and down the neck.  This doesn't work for sitting in a chair or reading propped up in bed - the headphones are jammed forward by the loop or levered up, depending on how the loop hits the chair or bedframe and pillow.  Either way, not comfortable, not workable.

reviewText: I purchased these headphones because I am really hard on the corded kind, and I find myself needing to replace them every year or two. A bluetooth headset seemed like the way to go. reviewText: After reading all of the incredibly positive reviews about this product I figured I'd give it a shot and buy a pair. After a couple weeks with it and using it mainly to pair with my Motoactv on workouts I can say that they are just OK. The sound quality is very good, the ease of use is high, and they feel very comfortable. The biggest issue I'm encountering is while I'm out on runs the audio will skip or cut out for seconds at a time and then come back. This happening once or twice an hour would be fine, but this is happening once or twice per song which is unacceptable. If I had to guess I'd say that the erratic playback is due to sweat causing problems with the headset since there is minimal to no issues when they're dry. The Motoactv shows no signs of issue with a wired headset during these times too, so I don't think that's the problem. I'll give them another week before saying goodbye and trying a different product. It's a shame too, these guys are solid otherwise.UPDATE: 12/27/2012: Returned these and went with the Moto S11's and won't be looking back. They are far superior for workouts than these headphones. These have better audio, but didn't serve the purpose I needed them for. Because of that I will keep my rating as is and not knock it because it wasn't the perfect fit for me. They are still a solid product.

reviewText: I bought this with the intention of using it with my HTC Thunderbolt mobile phone to listen to music and take phone calls wirelessly via Bluetooth. For that purpose alone the S305 is perfect. I have to admit I felt a little awkward at first trying to wear them on my head correctly but I got the hang of it quickly.  From my phone I get excellent quality music playback and stereo quality phone calls.  People say they can hear me just fine which is a nice surprise since the microphone is nearly impossible to detect.  I'm also surprised at the excellent battery life.  I don't think the battery is replaceable but on average I've been listening to music about 3 hours per day and use it for about 30 minutes of phone calls.  It hasn't ran out of battery power yet and is fully recharged in 10-30 minutes.  I have tried pairing it with a PC and a laptop.  So far no luck.  That could be something I'm doing wrong or incorrect drivers perhaps but since I really only wanted it to work with the HTC Thunderbolt that's what I'm rating it on for 5 stars.

reviewText: I wanted a pair of behind-the-head headsets for comfort reasons. These fit okay, but the user ergonomics are not to my liking.The volume controls are not tactile marked: I can't tell when I am on the + or - volume controls by touch. And, to make matters worse, when the mode changes, so does the volume. These headphones are capable of a high level so you can unexpectedly wind up having your ears blasted - without, in my case, the means to quickly adjust the volume.I wanted to use these with Skype and have the freedom to walk away from the computer when necessary. You don't get far with these: I managed about 10 feet away from the computer in repeated tests before the Bluetooth connection was lost.The audio feed from my music source did not shut off when I initiated a call. In fact, as soon as the call started ringing, the volume of the music shot up to its highest level.Overall, this unit offered the comfort level and fit that I was looking for - but none of the really useful things I need. Your experience may vary.Jerry

reviewText: For the money, this set is hard to beat. reviewText: I had always wanted a pair of bluetooth headphones, but could never get myself to spend the money on them myself. I received a different pair as a gift for Christmas and loved how they could be applied to my daily life, but they were an in-ear variety that had poor sound quality and was simply uncomfortable to wear.So, i returned them & began shopping around for a decent mid-range over-ear set when I found these. The reviews were glaringly positive & I see why.Sound Quality--I'm a musician, so I have fairly well trained ears. I certainly didn't expect studio quality sound from a $40ish pair of bluetooth headphones. However, the performance and sonic quality of this item greatly exceeded any of my expectations. They sound fantastic and are perfectly acceptable for any casual listener.Microphone Recording Quality--I use Siri quite a bit on my phone & haven't had any problems related to poorly received voice commands. In voice calls the worst people have said is "You sound a little different, but you sound fine." Again, perfectly acceptable for my standards.Weight--Very light weight. Zero complaints.The Fit--This is wildly different on an individual basis, so I can only relate my experience. I have a bit of a large head and wear glasses. Naturally the concern for anyone with glasses is feeling like you have a pile of stuff pulling down on your ears. These absolutely DO NOT interfere with my glasses. However, I have rather thin framed specs so it allows for plenty of extra room on my ear. That being said, even with thick emo style frames I think these would continue to work without bothering you. I even wear them with glasses while jogging on the treadmill without problems.Cell Phone Integration-- I absolutely love how well this headset works with my phones. I actually use an iPhone 5, but also have an older Evo 4G on hand. It works extremely well with both phones. It syncs quickly and easily, and the right-earphone has 4 well-disguised buttons for call/accept call, skip forward, skip back, and play/pause. All functions worked perfectly on both android and apple platforms. As a pleasant surprise I tapped the call button on my iphone while it was in a standby state. I was delighted to hear the little Siri sound blip in my ear & mic channel open to accept a voice command.Battery Life-- I've used this headset for roughly a half hour a day for a week & still going strong. It advertises 4-6 hours of use & I am inclined to believe it. It seems perfectly acceptable given the fact that this lightweight set of headphones cannot have a large battery in them weighing them down.Range-- Once again I was blown away by the performance. Last night I let my daughter play on my phone upstairs while I played with these downstairs. When I powered them on I was shocked when they connected to my phone 20 yards away through an entire floor's layer of construction. I can basically leave my phone anywhere in my house and simply keep my headset on. VERY nice for those times when you forget to stuff your phone in your pocket before walking away.Final Impressions-- I think what will make or break the use of this product for someone is simply the question of "Does it fit your head?" Beyond that, there's really nothing more you could possibly ask for given the dollars you'd be spending. I am sure there's a pair out there with slightly better sound or an extra button or two, but for the money you simply can't beat these.
title: Motorola S305 Bluetooth Stereo Headset w/ Microphone (Black) - Retail Packaging
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I was looking for an option that would allow me to workout without the restrictions of wires. I FOUND SO MUCH MORE! These headphones have become my daily drivers & I do mean DAILY! I rock them from sun up to sun down because the BATTERY LIFE & STANDBY TIME is SUPER! The sound quality is super for a non in ear, non noise cancellation option! I listen to a tone of music and have tested a tone of headphone options. WHY DO THESE SOUND BETTER THAN ALL THE IN EAR OPTIONS I'VE TRIED!? What takes the cake is that they have great sound, but they don't cancel out the noise around you so if you like to ride your bike in the city like me, you can mind your surroundings. The Bluetooth radius is true to specifications as long as you don't have a major object blocking the connection like multiple walls. The microphone is excellent at picking up your voice for hands-free calling and voice to text which also works better than most! As for what I bought them for, LOL they work flawlessly at the gym. Running, lifting, riding, basketball you name it, they are right there with you! There is a slight discomfort after about 45 minutes, but I have found that after about a month you get used to it or in my case it seems like it has adjusted to my head so I don't feel it. *Kanye Shrug* I wear them all day because when not in use I just lay them around my neck. Often times I forget I'm wearing them and they're not so bulky that they're unfashionable. I don't usually write reviews this long, but I really am a fan of this product! I highly recommend it!
title: Motorola S305 Bluetooth Stereo Headset w/ Microphone (Black) - Retail Packaging
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I made the mistake of upgrading from these headphones to LG's headphones. By far, these headphones are better due to their over-the-ear design, allowing the headphones to sit comfortably on the user's ears, and not block out external noises. This means you can exercise outside while wearing them and not be in danger of not hearing your surroundings. Also, you don't have any loose bits flying around, or thin wire and a lousy storage system for the earbuds, which is just annoying.The S305 offers beautiful sound for being an earlier bluetooth headset, and is basically a wireless upgrade from its more popular wired cousin, which I also believe is one of the best budget wired headsets one can buy for their money.The buttons are clear and intuitive, after a short while one can learn to control their devices with very little thought, though of course communicating with the device in my experience, has been a bit of a headache. Yet the S305 has managed to do this moreso reliably than compared with the LG. My device can at least be in my pocket while I am walking, and I will be able to play music with little to no interruptions.If you are torn between the S305 and LG's sad attempt at making a headset, definitely do go for the S305. It is cheaper, more practical and just plain works better.
title: Motorola S305 Bluetooth Stereo Headset w/ Microphone (Black) - Retail Packaging
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I wanted a pair of BT headphones to use at work to replace a pair of wired earbuds. I researched several models and this one stood out based on positive reviews and price. I've used them a few days now and they seem to be living up to their claim. They are fairly lightweight, comfortable, and the sound is impressive for their cost. I was surprised to see the various controls available on the headphones. Besides the obvious on/off and volume controls, it has remote control capabilities such as previous/next track, rewind/ff, play/pause, and stop - all conveniently located on the outer ring of the right headphone. The unit can also be used as a hands-free headset when connected to your phone. This is a definite winner!

reviewText: When I first got these, I hooked them up to my cell phone(samsung flight II) and the sound was horribly distorted in one ear... pretty pissed that this was happening, but not a big deal since I bought them from a freebie site... Once I got my new Iphone I hooked them up, AMAZING! The distortion was coming from my other phone, not the headphones.For $45 headphones these little guys have some kick-butt audio, I can put them on put my phone in the kitchen and clean my entire house(about 3500sqft) and I rarely loose connection or have it cut-out. I've had them for almost a year and they still work perfectly. They are extremely durable, even if they don't feel like they are.. I haven't exactly taken good care of them and they still sound and feel great.Also, I wear glasses, so finding over-the-ears headphones is hard for me, the back on these is thin enough to fit under glasses and not move them around.The only complaint is that they are "one size fits all" and aren't adjustable, so if you lean back and rest your head on a chair, they will probably come off if you have a small head.Charging only takes about 25mins and they stay charged for days.

reviewText: I had actually purchased a pair of these for someone else, and they ended up only needing one. reviewText: I bought this headset back in January 2009 and it is still working great!  I mostly use it paired with myApple iPod touch 8 GB (4th Generation) NEWEST MODEL. reviewText: I am using these with my iphone 4 and my ipad 1 and I am really very happy. Syncing with 2 devices is not a prob as long as you read the directions. As you can see from the tons of positive reviews, these are clearly the best on the market for the price range. I'd say they are probably worth far more than the listed price.Pro's:Very simple set up & operation. Just follow the docs.Sound quality is very good for BT wireless headphones.Very few (if any) drop outs. I walk the dog all day and they never skip or pause.Works great with Apple products (you knew know right?).Battery life seems great - I have used them for several hours on end for music and never ran into low battery warnings. They recharge fast.Hands down the BEST wireless BT headphones I have tried. I list the con's only out of full disclosure. None are a show stopper.Con's: (really pretty minor ones actually)Volume and operations buttons feel loose and flimsy. It would be nice to have more solid buttons as you will press them to often. Button placement takes a little getting used to.The max volume is a little low. This is probably to save battery life. While driving on the highway (or somewhere there is a lot of external noise) I have to turn them all the way up and even so it could be louder. For instance, trying to listen to classical music with soft passages or an audiobook is "iffy" on these if you have a lot of external noise.Lots of sound bleed - my wife tells me she can hear the music quite clearly even when I have them at half volume. I think this is a double edge thing - on the plus side the "open-ness" lets me hear sounds in the environment very clearly. The down side is everyone can hear the music and of course you aren't ever going to get "isolation" with these if that's what you are looking for.Lastly, they tend to hurt my ears after a few hours of wearing them. Maybe too tight? But then I do have a big head.

reviewText: I love bluetooth technology, after working in the tech industry for ten years anything that doesn't require wires brings a smile to my face.That said, these are fantastic headphones, I've only used them on a call once, but the performance was equally superb. They produce a beautiful sound, I am not saying it's 100% perfect and that some overly critical audiophile won't find a flaw in them... But for jamming out on a bus, or while jogging, or at a gym, or just walking around the house while your significant other is asleep they are fantastic.The only reason I dropped a star off, is that they are fragile, not in the general construct, but the about the volume buttons, the first unit I had I left in my car one too many times during the summer and the heat actually loosened the bonding material that fastens the volume up/down buttons; so that when I went to adjust the volume it just... "fell off". I send an email to the seller, as I was bit disgruntled and had only had them 3 months... Never got a response, bought a different pair think "**** you too!" which turned out to be just terrible and came running right back to a second pair of these.I highly suggest them, just be wary of how/where you store them.
