reviewText: I'll start with the fact that this is my first smartphone, so it was easy to impress me. I actually first got the HTC Sensation from Tmobile, but returned it the next day for this phone cause it suits me much better (I torture my phones). I don't regret the trade at all! This is a 100% android phone with all the awesomeness of the android marked, gps, netflix, and Pandora, and it's practically indestructible. I throw it in my cargo pocket along with keys and what not and it never scratches, I've dropped it multiple times and dropped things one it, still no scratches or cracks.. I actually took it for a 4 hour tubing trip down the river, the ultimate test, and it survived!!! I literally had it sitting in my cup holder on my tube with just the speaker out of the water so we could still have music. I threw it in my pocket and walked thru the river, with it continuously submerged in the water for minutes at a time. I can't believe it survived!! Still works flawlessly. I can't imagine owning any other phone now. Also, it's the perfect size. That's one reason I didn't like the Sensation. It's a monster. The Defy is also very lightweight, strangely lightweight actually.. VERY loud speakers - earpiece and main speaker. Fast processor for smooth operation (8MHz - new one's gonna have 1GHz), bright screen. Good battery life, not great, but I'm used to dumb phones anyways.... and 7 screens.. I don't know what you could possibly do with that many.. I only use 4.5 haha.. Great phone, love it, truly can take a beating and be submerged. Recommend to all!!
title: Motorola Defy MB525 Unlocked Cellphone with Android OS 2.2, 5MP Camera, Wi-Fi and GPS No Warranty - Black

reviewText: This power pack/charger was included in my Motorola Razr Droid smart phone package. It is quite thin and lightweight, with the size similar to a typical smartphone. Because it's so thin, the built-in battery doesn't hold that much power. So it's not likely to do a full charge of a typical device. I was able to charge from 10% to 50% of my Razr Droid Maxx, which lasts extra 2 hours with GPS tracking turned on.There are a lot of power pack with much higher capacity, but they may not be comfortable to charge on-the-go. I was able to have this power pack charging my smart phone in my jean pocket, without feeling the heat or any extra weight! So for as long as I only need to extend my phone for 2-3 hours of use, this ultra lightweight / thin power pack is perfect.
title: Motorola Universal Dual-Charging Portable Power Pack - Black - Retail Packaging
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Chargers', 'Travel Chargers'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Batteries, Chargers & Accessories', 'Power Strips']]

reviewText: This powerpack is well designed as it is slim, easily portable in a purse or bag and handy enough to charge any device that uses a micro-USB connection or a USB connection. It is best used for mobile phones to increase talk time but will also charge other devices like the Kindle or MP3 players. The input is through USB or a micro USB so you can use a wall charger or your computer or even a car charger to charge it. The output is a hardwired micro-USB cable and a USB port so you can either use the cable to charge your micro-USB device or use your own cable with the USB port to charge your iPod/iPhone etc.It does not charge an iPad or other devices using more power. If you're on the go or outdoors this is a very convenient powerpack to give additional talk time to your phone. This pack also holds the charge well so it can be very handy in a pinch.
title: Motorola Universal Dual-Charging Portable Power Pack - Black - Retail Packaging
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Chargers', 'Travel Chargers'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Batteries, Chargers & Accessories', 'Power Strips']]

reviewText: This charger is very small and very light. It comes with a charging chord for the computer and also for a wall socket. That makes it very convenient. These cables both connect to the devise with a micro-USB connector. The charger is all about the micro-USB. The built in cable is a micro-USB, which is great, if you have anything that uses a micro-USB. Like almost everyone else I know, I have an iPhone. I can still use the charger, but I still have to tote around other cables. If your phone and your computer have micro-USB connectors, this is a wonderful backup battery, as you won't even need to tote the extra cables around.The battery takes about two hours to charge, and for the iPhone3, it gives a solid charge. You will still need a iPhone to USB connector, as the backup doesn't connect directly to the iPhone. The good thing about this is it will work with a variety of devices, anything that you can put on the other end of a USB or mini-USB with work great with this battery.
title: Motorola Universal Dual-Charging Portable Power Pack - Black - Retail Packaging

title: Motorola Universal Dual-Charging Portable Power Pack - Black - Retail Packaging

reviewText: TheMotorola Universal Dual-Charging Portable Power Packis just one of a couple extra power packs I have and use occasionally. No doubt that they have their purpose and are a lifesaver when you need them, but for me I have found that time may far and few between.I charge my phone every night when I go to bed and if I expect to need my camera I do the same. My Kindle has rarely ever dropped to half a charge and really I don't know that it would ever constitute an emergency if it were to go dead. These of course and most all items that can charge via USB, can receive a charge using the Motorola Portable Power Pack. All you need to do is make sure the Power Pack itself is fully charged and pack it along with you. For me I have found that the only time any of these devices have come in handy, have been on day trips or vacations that keep me away from an outlet to charge my cell phone. So pulling this out of my purse and and adding a couple hours of power to my phone is definitely a nice thing to be able to do, but then again having your phone go dead and disconnecting yourself has its advantages too.If you are constantly finding yourself running low on power whether it be a phone, camera or other electronic device; then this may be helpful. You'll just need to make sure you keep the Power Pack itself charged so that it doesn't leave you high and dry too.
title: Motorola Universal Dual-Charging Portable Power Pack - Black - Retail Packaging
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Chargers', 'Travel Chargers'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Batteries, Chargers & Accessories', 'Power Strips']]

reviewText: This device is a battery designed to recharge any portable electronic device that you charge via a USB cable. I bought it for charging my iPhone and iPad when I'm on the road. You make sure the power pack has a good charge in it, then you plug in your device (don't forget to bring a USB cable) and you're good to go. (It also includes a built-in micro USB cable, which I did not use.)The power pack is surprisingly small -- smaller than the iPhone itself. Of course, that small size comes with a trade-off: battery charge. This device does not hold a substantial amount of power. In other words, if you're expecting to run your devices all day by charging them with this power pack, you're going to be disappointed.My iPhone 4 got about a half charge (50%) before the power pack ran out. It will give some power to an iPad, but this is really not an especially useful battery for a tablet.This device is best for recharging smaller devices that don't require much battery charge -- Bluetooth headsets and the like. Although it will charge your phone, it won't provide a lot of power. However, the fact that it's so small and portable does make it a decent choice for phones.
title: Motorola Universal Dual-Charging Portable Power Pack - Black - Retail Packaging
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Chargers', 'Travel Chargers'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Batteries, Chargers & Accessories', 'Power Strips']]

reviewText: The Motorola Universal Dual-Charging Portable Power Pack (P793) is a lightweight handy device for those on the go and comes packaged with nearly everything you'll need to charge portable devices, with exception of Apple portable devices. With Apple portable devices, you'll need your Apple charging cord which attaches easily through the power pack's USB charging connector. For portable devices that charge using a microUSB, the P793 has an attached microUSB for charging, eliminating the need to carry an extra charging cord.The first time charge for the portable power pack took approximately 1 hour and 45 minutes. As it was charging, the power pack has four indicator lights that will blink and will stay lit as it increases in charge until it reaches full capacity of 4 indicator lights, which is an added convenience, letting the user know how much reserve power will be on hand for a charge.I ran a couple of tests with some portable devices I had available, here is a list of the results:-- iPhone 4: Start of charge had a 22% battery, P793 was able to charge it up to 74% before the P793 ran out of power.-- iPhone 3GS: Will charge and charges much quicker than the iPhone 4.Edited 4/29/2011:-- iPad 1st Gen: Will charge, even though battery indicator reads "Not Charging." Thanks to Snap, Crackle and Pop, also a reviewer of this product, on the tip to check out if the battery % goes up after being plug in for a period of time.-- iPod Touch 2nd Gen: Will charge but only if the battery is not completely depleted. I found that since the battery was completely depleted, I had to use the my normal means of charging the iPod to get it past dead before the P793 would charge it. This bears to note that this may be the case with other portable devices.-- Sony Reader PRS-505: Will NOT charge.-- Kindle 3G + Wi-Fi: Will charge with attached microUSB.-- Version Wireless MIFI2200: Will charge with attached microUSB.I can see the P793 coming in handy while traveling and for every day use with it's convenience factor of not needing so many charging cords to be carried around, even though I was disappointed it wouldn't charge the iPad. Also an added plus is that you can charge the P793 AND charge two attached devices at the same time via the USB and microUSB charging connectors. But I recommend that you try your portable device with the P793 beforehand, to be sure that it will charge your portable device.
title: Motorola Universal Dual-Charging Portable Power Pack - Black - Retail Packaging
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Chargers', 'Travel Chargers'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Batteries, Chargers & Accessories', 'Power Strips']]

reviewText: This is a handy little device to give your smartphone a boost. I find I use it often with my Galaxy Nexus, which is quite a hungry battery user. It easily slips into a pocket and gives a "boost" to the battery when you need it. Great product.

reviewText: The first thing that struck me when I got this was the size.  It's very thin.The nice part about this is it easily slips into my laptop bag, my pocket, or many other places without being too much of a bother.  The downside is that means it doesn't have all that much juice.I've had a few of these battery packs, so I'll go through how I think this one stands up.The Pro's- Thin, fits easily in a pocket for day use- Contains a micro-usb cable, huge plus for portability.- Sturdy, feels quite well built, solid.The Con's- Power  at only ~1400mAh it's not going to give you a full charge on most things, but is enough to get a few more hours use out of most things.- Price, for this price there are (bulkier) 5000 mAh packs, but here you're paying a price for thinness, and the convenience of a cable built in.
title: Motorola Universal Dual-Charging Portable Power Pack - Black - Retail Packaging
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Chargers', 'Travel Chargers'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Batteries, Chargers & Accessories', 'Power Strips']]

reviewText: This is a very nice little pocket power supply.  It does what it says.  Works pretty well.  I just don't see myself carrying something around waiting on the sidelines for one of my gadgets to die on me.  I'm pretty particular about charging over night.  Being ready to go in the morning.  But I can see where this would come in handy if you used up a lot of juice on any one gadget on the go.
title: Motorola Universal Dual-Charging Portable Power Pack - Black - Retail Packaging
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Chargers', 'Travel Chargers'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Batteries, Chargers & Accessories', 'Power Strips']]

reviewText: The Motorola Universal Dual-charging power pack is a flexible battery pack designed to provide additional power on the go to your electronic devices.Size and shape are roughly equivalent to an iPhone 4, but smaller. Capacity is similar, with a 1,400 mAh battery built-in.The package contains the battery, a wall charger (with microUSB connector), and a USB to microUSB cable that can be used to charge the pack or to power a device.To charge the pack, simply plug in the wall charger or the supplied USB to microUSB cable into the side microUSB connector. The pack arrives partly charged, and charged fully in a couple of hours. The wall charger is very small and world-capable, a good feature.At the top of the pack you will find a USB jack, that can be used to power any device such as a cell phone; there is also a light blue rubber microUSB cable that neatly folds up around half of the unit, that can be directly plugged into any microUSB device (like a Motorola cell phone, or pretty much any new mobile phone thanks to recent European Union rulings)Even better, you can power two devices at the same time, and even power devices while the pack is being charged.The PowerPack is very reasonably priced, well designed and very useful. I like its use of the standard microUSB connector. Definitely a good toy to keep in your gadget bag. Highly recommended.
title: Motorola Universal Dual-Charging Portable Power Pack - Black - Retail Packaging
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Chargers', 'Travel Chargers'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Batteries, Chargers & Accessories', 'Power Strips']]

reviewerName: Gertrude, the Innocent "Live well, laugh loud...
reviewText: This is a nicely designed charger that works with my HTC Inspire smart phone.  The first few times I charged it up and dropped it in my purse for charging emergencies, it had drained before I needed it -- approximately one week from charge.The first time I had a fully drained phone and a full charger (one day old charge), I hooked up the charger using the blue cord, which is tucked into the side of it.  My phone said the battery was charging.  All four lights were on the Motorola charger.*When I went back twenty minutes later, it told me to connect my phone to a charger.  It is.) At this point the charger has 3 lights and one blinking.* Two hours later, my phone is charged to 18%. I hadn't made any phone calls or connected to the internet, so there was no reason for it not to have filled up more than that during that time.  The charger has 2 lights and 1 blinking.*After three hours of charging, my phone is at 53%, and the charger is down to 1 light and 1 blinking light.*After 3 hours and 15 minutes, my phone is at 59% charge and one blinking light is all of what's left in the charger.*At 3 hours and 30 minutes, my phone is charged to 69% and the charger is still blinking one light.  Three minutes later, my phone is at 70% and the charger is empty.I don't know how to account for 18% charging in two hours and twenty minutes compared to the 51% further charge after another one hour and 33 minutes.  I would say that it is just the phone but I know that I can plug it into the wall for 20 minutes and it will say 75% charge.I've only been using this for emergency charging and I haven't had trouble with it used that way, even though it did not fill up my phone charge.The problem is if you are going to be without reliable electricity and need this to provide a full charge.  I like charging devices on the boat, especially when we are anchoring out or sailing a lot because we may not turn on the engine for several days.There's a lot to like about this charger, as well.  It's very lightweight and slim.  If you look at it sideways, it looks a little like Kate Middleton.) The blue cord along the side also makes it easy to find in the deep, deep, dark well of my purse.I'm split on this device.  It is helpful to have in a pinch but I would be really mad if I paid for it.
title: Motorola Universal Dual-Charging Portable Power Pack - Black - Retail Packaging
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Chargers', 'Travel Chargers'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Batteries, Chargers & Accessories', 'Power Strips']]

reviewText: I picked this up before a recent trip to Denver where I am transient between cars and rooms in my parents' home. That said, with having a baby in tow as well, I've really benefited from having the Motorola Power Pack at my disposal. I've been plugging the charging cable directly into the power pack then the pack into the phone so both get a full charge at night and I'm not left guessing whether I can rely on the pack being ready to go the next day.As the pack is by the same manufacturer as my phone, they may interact better than others may experience. However, the pack does get quite warm-to-hot when charging the phone on the go and that does given me pause for concern.I also like that the power pack's charger cable is so long, unlike the cable that came with my phone that barely reaches the top of my night stand.All told, I'm quite pleased with this product. It beats having an extended battery pack full-time even if it means carry a second power source in my purse.

reviewText: This item has been sooo darn helpful for my silly Droid 4 which is seemingly ALWAYS low on power.  It can generally recharge my Droid 4 twice and keep me in communications. You know, for when I need to charge one and for when I can't figure out where I set one down, I can usually find the other. reviewText: I purchased this item for my wife to charge her Motorola Photon.  She can put her phone in her purse and charge this while on the go, or not near a outlet.  It provides up to 5 hrs of charging according to the manufacturer, and I have found that to be very accurate.  It's very small and light weight.  Even though I bought it for her photon it does fit any device with a micro USB which is most of the newer smartphones.  It fits my Samsung Galaxy S2 and my daughters HTC Evo and HTC Evo Shift.  The item is made very well.  This item is not made for charging while using, so that is something to take into consideration.  It's used for charging while your phone or item is not in use.I also loved that if the device is not in use, it will automatically shut off so that the juice is not wasted.

reviewText: I touted this little bad-boy around with me on a recent family vacation, and I'm glad I did. One day when we were out and about I noticed that my phone battery was dead. I plugged this in and was able to use my phone.The really nice thing about this pack is the built-in mini-USB cable. All you need is this, no cables, and you can supply power to any mini-USB device. I have a camera, video camera, and smartphone which all can get powered off this one pack.The only drawback to me is that this will not charge your device like plugging it into your charger will. It's slow to add a charge, but maybe that's all you need for emergencies.The device is very small and light. I slipped it into a pocket in my backpack, but it will fit in most purses and even a pocket. I think it's very handy and a great thing to have around in case of emergency.
title: Motorola Universal Dual-Charging Portable Power Pack - Black - Retail Packaging

reviewText: This is a pretty nice device to have in one's bag or purse for those times you need an emergency charge.  I've tried it on an iPhone 3G, iPhone 4, Moto BT earpiece, and a couple of older generation iPod Nanos and it has done a good job on all the devices.  I fully charged it and have had it in my bag for a couple of weeks without touching it and when I turn it on it looks like it has held pretty much all of its charge.It can accommodate a standard USB plug and has a micro USB plug built in to it.  Note, there is NOT a MINI USB connection built in.  To charge something that uses a mini USB you have to have an additional wire that goes from standard USB to mini USB.  I personally don't have anything that can be charged via micro USB and several things that can be charged via mini USB so I would have liked to see an integrated mini USB line included.  I'm guessing all newer Moto stuff uses micro USB.  Minus a quarter of a star for not showing the mini USB any love...It is a very nice size being just smaller and just as thick as an iPhone 4.  Very light weight.  To charge the unit itself a dedicated micro USB port is provided.  It can charge via the included wall plug to micro USB or standard USB (from your computer) to micro USB.  If you feel like you might need to charge it while out you need to carry an additional plug or cable.  I think it would have been nice if they could have integrated a flip out standard USB plug for charging.  Or made a mini USB port available for charging so that you could use the same standard USB to mini USB cable you would likely carry around anyway.  In either case you could eliminate the need to carry a cord around just for charging.  Again, minus a quarter of a star...  Rounding keeps this thing with a 5 star rating.Overall, a nice and handy thing to have for those times you head out for dinner or drinks after work and find your smart phone giving you the "low battery" warning.  It is small enough to plug in to your phone and stick both in to a pocket/bag to charge while on the go.  No need to search out a bar seat next to an outlet (I know I've been there).
title: Motorola Universal Dual-Charging Portable Power Pack - Black - Retail Packaging

reviewText: For many years my wife & I had the same model phones (Blackberry Pearl), so when we traveled we brought along 1 car adapter, 1 AC adapter, and 1 spare battery (total investment about $25).So if you only have one phone/device, or have a spouse/business partner/etc who has the same model phone, this is my recommended strategy.However, when my wife got a different Blackberry model, and I started traveling with a small tablet, we found ourselves with 3 different devices. That's where I would recommend this universal power pack.It's slightly smaller than my Blackberry Pearl, weighs about 2 oz, fairly portable (though not as small as a spare battery). It seems to charge up fast (a couple hours) and will charge up any small device that accepts micro or standard USB. Brilliant idea, actually, but not perfect. It will charges my Blackberry from 10% to about 80%, which will last me 3-5 days with moderate use. And it charges my small Archos tablet (it's about 1/2 the size of an ipad) from 10% to about 60%, which will also last me a couple of days.However, keep in mind, the power pack won't bring back my tablet if it's completely dead. Also keep in mind, you'll still need to have access to a car or wall outlet to recharge your power pack. So again, if you just have one device to keep track of, just keeping a spare adapter & spare battery in your car, purse, or suitcase is probably more effective than keeping track of a brand new, larger, & more expensive device.I gave this device a full charge & just keep it in the glove box for travel. Like any battery, it will lose a little juice this way, so recharge every 3 months or so if this is your strategy.Hope this helps!
title: Motorola Universal Dual-Charging Portable Power Pack - Black - Retail Packaging
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Chargers', 'Travel Chargers'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Batteries, Chargers & Accessories', 'Power Strips']]

reviewText: This is a nice product for the price. It's about the same length and thickness as an iPhone and about 3/4 as wide. It weighs half what an iPhone does. It includes a micro USB cable that cleverly wraps into the charger. There's a full sized USB outlet for attaching other charging cables, like Apple's. You can charge both the Power Pack and a plugged in device simultaneously when you've connected the power plug into a wall outlet. The unit is small and light enough to keep in a pocket.As for capacity, it will charge a Kindle 3G a bit over 1/2, and an iPod touch to about 70% capacity. Compared to more powerful external battery units, that's about right, considering its price. All in all it's a useful backup.

reviewerName: Nathan M. Rose "Movie Guy from FlickDirect"
reviewText: With mobile phones almost becoming a "must have" as much as a wallet on you at all times it is important that you never run out of juice. And now this is more important than ever with smartphones not lasting all day long. Enter the battery chargers. However which one is right for you? While the Motorola charger is good when you are in a bind, it is only a quick fix and you will soon find yourself again without a phone. My suggestion is to get this only  if you need once in a while, if you are a road warrior and are in need of a constant charge every afternoon for your phone, then look for a more powerful one.
title: Motorola Universal Dual-Charging Portable Power Pack - Black - Retail Packaging
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Chargers', 'Travel Chargers'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Batteries, Chargers & Accessories', 'Power Strips']]

reviewText: Most of these chargers are specific in what they will charge, such as an iPhone. This charger is unique in that it will charge just about anything.  Just plug it in and charge it (flashing light let's you know it's charging), and select the battery life indicator to know how charged the battery is.  Use the built in micro USB to charge your Sony Digital Camera, for example, or to charge your iPhone you'll need your iPhone charger; plug the USB into the Motorola Portable Power Pack and charge your phone directly.This is a very versatile power pack, it's compact and simple, but there are a lot of pieces to include when traveling.  For example, to charge your iPhone you'll need the power pack, wall charger (to recharge the battery), and iPhone charger.If you're need is to charge an iPhone, iPad, or iPod, go with something like this [[ASIN:B002OEBMZM Kensington Mini Battery Extender and Charger for iPod and iPhone 1G, 3G, 4G (Black)]. If you have other things to charge like a rechargeable battery in a camera then this is a good product.
title: Motorola Universal Dual-Charging Portable Power Pack - Black - Retail Packaging

reviewText: I have an iPhone and an iPad, and a Motorola CommandOne Bluetooth.This charger worked really well on my phone and bluetooth device, but be aware that it doesn't work for the iPad.These are some of its features - it comes with an integrated micro USB charger cable and a USB charging connector. You can charge two devices at the same time (like your phone and bluetooth), and at the same time you can even be recharging the charger itself.The biggest plus for me on this charger is its size and weight - it's very light and smaller than an iPhone. I have had other portable chargers and they've all been fairly hefty.The other good thing is that it charges up quickly, and that it has a wall power adapter which is great because I can charge it from another location. (I do not have a laptop so I need to power up with the wall adapter if I'm not home.) It's also possible to use your car charger.Overall, I am very happy with this and I recommend it. I have not used it for any extended period of time, so if I encounter any problems I will come back and revise this review.

reviewText: I'm a power nerd - not the kind of power that lets me boss people around, but the kind that needs a power outlet by noon thanks to the lousy battery in my Galaxy Nexus. The Motorola Universal Dual-Charging Portable Power Pack (stupid name) is quite brilliant - it delivers full current charging, it has a decent capacity battery built in, it has a built in MicroUSB cable and it can charge off any MicroUSB cable. To top it all off, it has a reliable battery indicator and a USB output.You really can't ask for more - this thing gets most 1500mAh battery packs charged to near 100% and it is extremely thin, making it the perfect accessory for your jacket pocket or purse.If you have a MicroUSB device, invest in this - you won't regret it.

reviewText: Very pleased with the compact size, quality and simplicity of this gadget.Like many smartphone users, sometimes on a job my battery won't last a whole day. You can use this to power while you use the phone, or have it charge the phone while inactive.The build in cable that tucks away into the unit is very helpful.Great price, and motorola hardware quality is traditionally very solid.Simple design, with indicator lights to show you status/charge level.As someone mentioned, this isn't something to take out to the wilderness and expect to be able to get days of battery life, but it'll definitely help you get through a busy day with heavy use/high battery drainage, or through a day of travelling.
