title: Motorola Droid 2 Extended 1800mah Lithium Ion Battery-Snn5875 Bp7x Factory One Year Warranty

reviewText: Pros: Read the reviews about this battery and it does work but it does not fit securely and the door that comes with it doesn't help at all.  First the battery is ridiculously large but i could deal with that because the battery lasted a long time compared to the standard, I even let it charge for overnight like some ppl said to avoid issues.Cons: The door was almost impossible to get on because it didn't quite fit so had to force it with alot of pressure.  It literally reboots several times a day which at first I was ok with because if you were careful picking it up or sitting it down it wouldn't reboot.  Now after 3 months it reboots 5 or more times every single day and I just cant take it anymore.  It reboots because the battery doesn't fit snugly and the door doesn't help in that department so then the connectors between the phone and the battery loses connection if their is any movement.  Because the battery is not a snug fit the connectors can disconnect at anytime and the phone will not turn back on, you have to open the door then push it back in with extreme force then the phone will turn back on.  I don't recommend this phone unless you don't mind it turning off when you put it in your pocket or purse or case or even when you take it out.  I'll be in the middle of a call and it just turns off, extremely annoying.  Just stick with the regular OEM Extended Battery and keep the standard battery charged as a backup if you travel, no it doesn't last as long but you won't have as many issues.
title: Motorola Droid 2 Extended 1800mah Lithium Ion Battery-Snn5875 Bp7x Factory One Year Warranty

reviewText: I havent had it long enough to say how different it is compared to the stock battery. I am hoping it is better though since I have been using the stock battery for 3 years now.

reviewText: I have had several bluetooths over the years. They work great and you don't have to worry about grabbing your phone while you are driving. This one you can program two phone to it. Which is great if you have your personnel phone and a company phone you have to carry around.  The only draw back on this product is if doesn't give you a warning that the product is going bad. But they do tell you when your battery is getting low. I like that. It's easy to use. Would recommend this products to others.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: I was so happy to receive my beloved Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset about 3 wks ago, only to be disappointed and have my bubble burst.  I read the reviews good and bad, weighed that odds and decided to ignore the complaints about the headset dying within 2 wks of purchase.  I threw away the packaging and guess what...my Bluetooth stopped working!  UGH!!!  Now, I'm stuck with a $52 DUD.  Thanks for nothing!
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: this works great, make sure your phone is set to blue tooth and the unit is always charged....I have both a car charger and and an AC adapter
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: I have been using this bluetooth headset for almost a year now.  Recently, I used it for almost 9 hours straight without recharging, and it worked flawlessly with charge still left.  I am really impressed with the battery life.  It easily recharges with a micro USB cable, charger included.  And there is a small blue/red light on it to show if it needs charging.I also really like the audio prompts in the ear, and that you can hear a faint beep about every 10 seconds when mute is on, to know that you really are muted.  It also has a button on the side for activation and deactivation (off-hook and on-hook).  It is the silver button with the M symbol on it.I have had no complaints from anyone that they cannot hear me.  I also think that they can only hear my voice, and not background noise.  It fits comfortably over your right ear, but can be readjusted (with some effort) for the left ear.  And it also seems to have a range of about 25 feet or so from the phone, if you do not carry the phone with you.  After that, it loses signal.All in all, I would definitely recommend this bluetooth headset.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: I have had many bluetooth headsets and have preferred the Motorola H series flip boom because it is a simple-to-use on/off switch.  The H730 has some nice features over its predecessors including:- Ability to pair with up to two phones simultaneously.  If you have two phones like I do (personal and work supplied), the H730 does an excellent job of pairing both phones and allowing communication switching between the two including voice dial.- Voice Status.  The H730 provides voice status on battery level as well as phone connection; well done.- Voice Quality. I've never understood why Bluetooth voice quality has never been great, but, the H730 is as good as I've experienced with a bluetooth headset.  No complaints from callers on the other end.- Battery Life.  Very good as I have come to expect from the past H series devices.  I have not completely drained the H730 nor received any battery warnings even after talking well over an hour.Room for Improvement- Once feature I miss from the older H series units is a color coded LED battery strength signal (green, yellow, and red).  I have not experienced a low battery status, so the unit may provide a visual low battery signal and I'm unaware of it.All in all, this is an excellent device and comes recommended based on my experience with many bluetooth headsets.UPDATE: After a few years of experience with the H730, my opinion remains that it's a 5 Star product.  I recently bought the newer Motorola HX550 thinking maybe it would be an upgrade; it's not.  The H730 is better in every way including:- wearing comfort,- slipping on and off the ear,- call quality for me wearing the H730,- call quality for the person I am talking to (yes, I have compared both units with multiple people on the other end; the H730 was preferred each time), and- button controls (the vol buttons are better on the HX550 but the large command button most used is superior on the H730).I have had plenty of bluetooth headsets and the H730 as of March 2013 is still the best I have tried and I have tried units that cost nearly $200.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: Works as good as new !!! I love this noninvasive style where it's NOT sticking in my ear ... After 10 hours of wearing it you still don't know it's there... My other one sticks IN my ear and after a hour I want it OUT !!!
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: I purchased 2 of these... One for me and one for my wife. One stopped charging so I contacted Motorola directly and theyshipped me a new one out. Just have to return the defective one. Love amazon!!! and Motorola's great customer service.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewerName: D. Deutsch "Chance favors the prepared mind."
reviewText: The Moto H730 Bluetooth headset is a good midrange device of this type. I actually bought this one for my mother who does alot of driving after having owned this model for awhile.  Sound is decent and it sits pretty securely on the ear, just don't tilt your head to the right as it will swing away and lose grip. It sits far more securely than the cheapo headsets in the entry level range I have used in the past. My iphone connected right away on first contact and does so reliably after about four months of use.  However, I have found that voice command recognition ability has degraded considerably and I don't know why.  When I first got the unit, it recognized all the dial commands I threw at it. Now, I encounter many errors but I use it to receive calls for the most part anyway.  Overall, I am still satisfied with this device.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: This is a great headset but I switched to the Motorola HX550 for several reasons. First, it has A2DP which means it will play audio through the headset. You can listen to music or any other audio from the phone with the HX550. Second it is a lot more comfortable because it is much smaller but it is actually louder. It may be louder because of the in the ear configuration. You have to get the unit with the in ear earpiece. Some of the OEM packaged units omit this earpiece. Third it has Crystal Talk which makes it far clearer in a noisy background. The one advantage of the H730 is the amazing battery life. 12 hours for the H730 vs 9 hours for the HX550.I have both headsets, I give the H730 four stars but the HX550 five stars.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: It was just what I was looking for...I can't talk on the phone without my blue tooth and this was a better version of the one I had! And it arrived pretty fast!
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: So far I really like this earpiece.  I have a weird shaped ear so earbuds fall out, and most other headsets wont fit, even with eargels.  I like that its no frills and think the lack of A2DP is a plus.  I hate it when my music starts playing all over the place, I just needed this for calls so I dont get a ticket.  Most importantly it can get LOUD.  I had it when I have to strain to listen.  I say give it a try,  I lokked at the H720, but for a few extra bucks figured I get this as it has an extra noise canceling mic.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: I recently got this in replacement of another headset and it is excellent. I love the practicality of flipping it open to start it. It can also connect to two phones simultaneously. The sound quality is the best of any bluetooth headset I have ever owned. It pairs and connects beautifully with my Sprint EVO and my Apple iPHone.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: Love my new 730.  The instant on is a neat feature, no more waiting while you're trying to pickup a call.  Battery life is extraordinary.  Every now and then my wife complains about my voice fading in and out... not sure what that is about.  My son said my voice sounds a little tinny.  But seems like a great headset to me.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: This is my third Motorola Bluetooth in this category. Over the years I have gone from the H710 to 720 and now 730. I have found them all to be good sound and convenient to use. I just wish they can make one that announces itself before it goes into the washer so I don't keep ruining them.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: I love this Motorola 730 Bluetooth Headset. you are able to turn your phone volume down and still know when you receive a phone call. The automated voice announces when you receive a phone call. It also tells  you when it's time to charge it. I recommend this product to all. Mostly it allows you to DRiVE and to do whatever without holding your phone. Hands Free'
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: had this before washed it, got it again lost it, trying again so far not to bad but battery life is not as good as its predecessors I may have gotten a bad one...
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: Bought this for my wife after the dog eat other one, she is more happy with this one more-so than the plantronic she has before,  fit on ear is excellent along with sound quality.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: The product info is not clear enough. This headset, even though moderately high price does not support A2DP, so no music, navigation/gps or other phone audio is transported. Does allow access to Siri on iPhone 4s. Call audio, send and receive is good, noise reduction OK. Wind reduction none functional. Voice prompts are a useless feature in my opinion, they interupt during calls and are irritating after a short time. But, they can be de-activated. Battery life is fantastic. A good basic headset, not particularly a good match for a Smartphone.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: This is a strange thing that has happened and that is the ONLY reason Im giving the product 2-stars.... I ordered a 720 and a 730 and both have so much vibration and howling echos every time I use it, that it un-nerves me.  I love the products but the noises in them make me think they are less than good items.  I'll contact the seller and see what they can do for me.  TBD after I contact seller to see what they can do.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: Works amazing! We use it for our Galaxy phone and Gransdstream phone! It works amazingly well! We love it and recommend it!
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: It fit very loosely, just didn't feel quite right, wife and I both agreed on that. I was actually hoping to like it, just it looks way cool and got a lot of good reviews. Been a while so sorry, I don't recall if the sound was very good or not, but the fit was the killer anyway so for me at least, that mattered less anyway.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: I wanted something that would let me listen to my music as well as my calls, this did not. It only allowed calls on  my phone, a Samsung GS3. Had to return it.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: This was reasonably priced on here and I purchased this because I lost my other one which was a H720.  It's almost the same with the exception of an instructor instructing you on the different functions of this product.  I really like it.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: Good item, however could not get to work very good.  However, the ones I buy from Verizon and other companies are not as good either.  Not the sellers problem.  the makers
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: Bought this for my brother after getting mine. Don't have to charge it as often as my older one and has a longer stand by when using.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: Good product easy to pair with blue tooth and price was right and this unit talks to you with instructions,
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: So here is the scoop.  If you think you can get music or notifications sounds with this bluetooth, think again. The phone audio works great, sounds great.  Battery lasts a long time, BUT you cannot get music or any kind of notification tones through this bluetooth.  I am using an LG VS980 phone.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: I am comparing this new H730 to the H720.  I have been using an H720 for over a year and love it- it is extremely comfortable, has great range, and the flip on/off is fantastic.I bought the H730 because some people complained about background noise- water running, dishwasher, etc.  Well, the H730 does, indeed, cut out a lot of that noise, and yet retains the all the nice features and specs of the older version.  Range is easily 40 feet without obstruction.  I can go most anywhere in my house without carrying the phone around.I find the "talking" it does to tell you the connection state and battery level to be a bit gimmiky and somewhat irritating- especially if the phone is ringing and the headset is off and you are waiting for it to connect.  The manual implies it can be turned off, but I can't seem to do that.  It is probably my only complaint.If you hate in-ear headsets as much as I do, this is a PERFECT headset for you.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: I've had my first Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset for quite a while, now.  Years and years!  So many I've lost track.  It finally won't charge so I'm buying another.  Love it so much I'm buying the same one!I can't stand anything in my ear.  This bluetooth sits on the ear, not in it.I like how it turns on and off.I love the voice telling me the phone status (tho I find it to be too loud and the volume can't be adjusted).Don't know about anyone else, but using voice recognition to dial a number just doesn't work for me.  I say a 3-syllable name and it dials a one-syllable name.  What's up with that?  Tho it may be my phone not the headset.But this headset is very, very comfortable, easy to hear, easy to use.I highly recommend it.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: This is my 3rd Motorola headset. I had 2 H700 (?) models. First one went through the washing machine, second one got smashed, so I got this one. This model is better than H700 in that when you turn it on, it tells you it is connected to your phone and it even tells you the battery level. The sound is clearer too.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: Awesome Bluetooth! Very good call quality! Also very comfortable and lightweight too! Overall a very nice product to use every time I make a call!
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: This is the best headset I have used, though I'm not a headset person. I only use them on road trips. They work well for me and I think the cost is reasonable, too. I have used them with three different phones, including two different iPhones, and they have worked well with all of them.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: I had a Plantronics & the sound was horrible. I saw someone with one of these & he recommended it. It is great. You can actually hear the other person. It is easy to set-up.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: I had extremely high hopes for the H730 as there were some great improvements in the H715 coming from the H710.  If I had to choose the best H7XX series bluetooth headset ever made by Motorola, It would have to be the H715 (they've stop making them so get them wherever you can).Why do I say this.  The voice prompt "latency" when connecting to your phone once a conversation has started is awful.  You have to wait for the boot up sound, then if your paired with two phones, it has to tell you the status, "Phone 1 connected, battery level is high, Phone 2 connected." and then a small pause and then you can finally hear the person on the other side and by then you have to ask them to repeat themselves.  I think the voice prompts are great for the H720 as it can only be pair to one phone and thus the voice prompts should be quicker but on the H730 its a mess as you can pair the headset with two phones.The other issue is non of the H7XX series have lasted more than 18 months.  I must admit that I use them hardcore 6-8 hour calls sometimes.  I've used the Motorola warranty 2 of the 3 times as one was more than 12 months.  I've either received a refurbished headset or a brand new one.So, I give it a 3.5 STARS thus far.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: There are many blue tooth headsets but most project into the ear canal. The H730 does not! There is a lesser expensive version but the on off switch is in the mike lever and breaks easily. This one seems to be more substantial. The volume is good with or without hearing aids and it is a excellent buy.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: good clear audio, holds charge well but it does not announce the incoming callers number
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: I received this about 5 days ago and immediately charged it and started using it. The last couple of blue tooth units I have had found it hard to make it through the day. I am on my 4th day and still my initial charge. Granted, these have been a little lighter use than normal due to illness but I just shut if off and and restarted it to check the battery life and it reconnected immediately and said battery level is high still. I now am going to nor charge and see how far it will go. Sound volume is good. It really a little too loud for me. I have it turned as low as it will go and it is still too loud in quiet situations. When asking around, the callers on the other end say sound is loud and clear but a little muffled or canned but still good. With all that and the fact this sits on the outside of my ear, it is good enough to keep and recommend. The only reason it is not 5 star so far is the inability to get the volume low enough and the slightly muffed sound on the other end.Update 3.20.13 It has been about a week of light use for this headset. I was sick a couple of days and did not go to work and therefore did not turn it on. When I wear it, I do not turn it off between calls. A couple of the days were not so light use and I am still on the same initial charge. When I just closed and open the boom to restart it to hear the battery condition, it still says "battery high". I am going to not charge it just to see how far it will go.3.21.13 most of the way through another 14 hour work day and several calls on my headset, it lost its connection and I had to actually go through the pairing process again. When I did the battery level has finally dropped to medium. I am going to guess the battery voltage drop had something to do with the pairing connection and am finally charging it for the first time since the initial charge.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: Arrived on time, and well protected in original factory packaging.  I like the way that it speaks to me, tells me that it is on, and informs me of the battery capacity in a very clear voice.  Most of my callers do not even know that I am on a bluetooth device.  I have been wearing it for 3 days now, and the battery capacity is still high. Great job guys, Happy New Years.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: The Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset is one of the best headsets on the market.  I have experimented with other blue tooth headsets and the H730 offers the best clarity, comfort, and functionality as compared to other intrusive earpieces on the market.  While it is slightly larger than other Motorola headsets it still offers the same comfort and features as similar Motorola models.  This model was able to sync easily with the two cell phones that I carry daily (work phone and personal phone).The device can be simply powered on by flipping the microphone boom or closing it to power it off.  When flipped open a voice prompt indicates whether phone #1 and or #2 is connected as well as the battery charge level.  One is also able to distinguish which phone may be ringing if a specialized ringtone has been set up for each phone. The Motorola comes with quite a few additional features such as call answer, reject, voice dialing, volume level increase/decrease, etc., that can be controlled by one of the the three push buttons located at the top, center and bottom portions of the earpiece.  A separate electrical outlet charging cable is included, but the earpiece can also be charged with a typical usb charging cord as well and plugged into other usb capable devices.Overall, I am very pleased with this purchase.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: I first bought this product for myself. I found it easy to use and store away when not using. I loved it so much my mother wanted it so I gave it to her as a gift. She loves the ease of use. I would highly recommend this product to friends and family. Thank you
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: For waht I paid, I did not get what I expected. This is more like a $20 quality item. It is loose on the ear, it lets a lot of background sound through, and it sounds tinny to the listener when I talk - I tested it a lot.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: Leave a voicemail for yourself with your phone and with your headset. If you can tell the difference, it's not a good headset! Back to Plantronics for me. This Moto headset is so tinny-sounding that my DroidX will not recognize "yes" or "no" answers when voice dialing. Sad. Returned.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: I gave this Bluetooth a rating of 3 because I get a mixture of people saying my voice sounds muffled while using the headset all the time.  Being that this was a used headset I kind of expect it wasn't going to work as if it was brand new from the store.  Overall, it has some high-tech features that I like compared to my old one I lost.  It does the job for now...
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: I was able to pair the headset without difficulty.  The headset appears to work for about 10 minutes or so..... then the trouble starts.I will hear "headset disconnected" then less than one second later "headset connected, battery level is high".  It will do this repeatedly for 20 to 30 minutes.I've been through two of these units now, both with the same fault.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: Just a great piece of equipment to own if you have an iPhone.  I've always had a problem hearing the caller on each version of the iPhone (3G and 4).  This bluetooth really seems to amplify the call, and from what is reported the caller hears me well too.The earpiece is comfortable, and the battery seems to last a long time (I've only needed to charge it 5-6 times over 2 months and it's used for a half hour daily).For the price, I don't think this can be beat.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: second headset works perfectly with LG800g, LG505c, and Moto i576. have two phones tied to the headset and it handles both well switching between calls/phones without droping ether one.  The first one of these was a plain brown wrapper one that did not work the second was a full retail version (for a few dollars more) that worked very well.  Battery life is very good giving an easy 6hrs+ talk time even after months of use.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: Apple iPhone 3G compatible headset - works great!  H730 works as it should. Paired effortlessly with my older Apple iPhone 3G with updated Apple IOS 4.2.1 (I no longer needed to key in a PIN under Apple IOS 4.2.1). Sound quality is fine for phone calls - both on my end, and the other end of a phone call. The on/off boom switch is great - positive on/off action - makes the headset very stable on the ear when on, and very compact for pocketing when off.  Built-in voice prompting makes usage easy. Controls are ergonomic in general, but up/down volume controls are a little small and can be tricky to fumble with when changing, but not too big that they'll accidentally get tripped. Construction appears to be durable. No complaints so far - will update if there are any issues.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: I bought this for a friend.  He uses it daily and all day and is very happy.  THe sound quality is excellent and it is very comfortable.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: I think that motorola made a decent headset here for the price. I would recommend this this to anyone, 4 stars because when first flipping open to turn on, the moto theme music that comes on followed by the womans voice saying the battery level is enough to make even a deaf persons ears bleed. So you flip it open, wait til it gets that outa the way, then it will be safe to use.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: I am very satisfied with quality, noice cancellation, and ability to connect to multiple devices. I have 4 stars, and I say its not perfect because of 2 issues. Issue#1: I could not turn OFF the voice prompts. Manual says "either volumn button, and call button until you hear-Voice prompts Off", I gave that up on that after a couple of tries. Issue#2: Delay in connection. It takes at least 15 seconds to connect after I open the device up. (with the voice prompts, the total is about 22 seconds). I use this while driving, but the bluetooth is not always on my ear. When I get a call, I take it out from my pocket/dashboard and put it up on the ear. Now with this delay, it takes 22 seconds for call to be transfer. In H720, I think I could do this in less than 10 seconds.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: My wife whom is the primary user of this unit reports that she is very happy with it. I can't specify the options bells and whistles, but those things are all background noise since it all works and enhances the user experiences! So, she is one happy camper and loves the unit!
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: I bought this blutooth for my father. He drives a truck for a living and he loves the flip open feature. He always thanks me for getting it for him every time we talk so thats a 5 star for me!
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: Received on time, everything working less speaker. Gives sometimes a cracky not understandable voice or no sound at all. Too expensive to return. Verizon packaging bad, all loose inside the plastic, could be used stuff.
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: Sounds great good battery holding up well. Good sound. Fir driving a tractor trailer this is good but like my blue parrott b250 + better
title: Motorola H730 Bluetooth Headset

reviewText: At first I thought the brand wouldn't matter, so I bought those $5 Walgreens chargers. Turns out they take twice the time to charge your phone and break twice as fast. So I bought this after seeing the Motorola brand. Awesome. Great build and charges quickly. I have an HTC One (M7 model).

reviewText: Looks exactly like the one that came with my phone and works exactly like it.  I have bunch of these laying around the house because I'm too lazy to get one, if it's in another room.  I don't have any issues with it -- functions as advertised.

They are so cheap that we usually by three when we purchase and keep the extras for emergencies.Also the cable that is supplied works great for charging or connecting to the computer and I have yet to have one fail.  We have given them to guest who have forgotten theirs and none of them has ever had a problem charging their phones with it.It just works.

I have zero complaints and am very happy with the price and quality. Thankfully this works with all all of the droid phones I have had and my girlfriend's (Moto Droid 1 and 2, Droid X, Droid Incredible 2, and Galaxy).7 month update: Still working great. Very happy with this purchase.Update: It has been over a year and I am still using these with no problem. Very happy with this purchase. I have even purchased 2 more and have had no issues with any of them.

reviewText: The same charger that came with the phone.  The USB cable is pretty short, so I replaced it with a longer one.  Does the job!

reviewText: I just bought a Motorola Atrix 4g and wanted a wall charger for my desk at work. This was such a great deal that I bought 2 chargers. One for work and another for a back up. I highly recommend it as a replacement or back up to your standard charger.

reviewText: Works great! It looks like the OEM charger and does the job. It's a good price as well.I'll have to order another one because I left mine in the hotel room.

reviewText: The charger worksd fine. I use it all the time.The price is very good. You can charge through wall outlet or pc. Verry convenient

reviewText: Misrepresented Product.What is described and was ordered was 3 of the swivel earhooks as pictured and described in a single package.  What was received was ONE of the described earhooks and several other kinds including the rigid hooks that poke the back of your ear and rubber tabs that fall out of your ear if you move your head at all.  NOT 3 of the units pictured and described.The seller you want to avoid (and pick one which will send the product as represented) is Black Sea International LLC.

reviewText: I like that they were delivered within a week and getting 3 for that great price is wonderful. The only reason why I rated it 4 stars is because the earhook is rather tight and it breaks easily. I wondered why when my friend purchased the Bluetooth he sent extras. Now I know why...

reviewText: the ear loop replacements are not as advertized or pictured. they are made of solid piece of plastic with no swivel or chrome tip.If you want to use on either ear you have to remove the entire ring and reverse it. This add is deceiving.

reviewText: We use this on any phone that takes the micro-din adapter, regardless of phone brand name, and it works fine on all the units.  Good price and I have 15+ years of being imrpessed by the durability of Motorola products.

reviewText: Awesome charger! I've had zero problems with these things. It can go from the wall to your computer. Just don't let your kid put it their mouth. It will short it out...lol!
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: Generally it is a good charger and charges fast but the cable is way too short. I wish it was a little bit longer
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: Even though it's only 0.7 Amps, it works just fine (with an extension cable even) on my Galaxy Nexus. This is a sign of good engineering, to me, and why in some cases you don't want to buy a crap off-brand.
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: This is an excellent replacement or spare charger.  Works just like the original that came with my phone - perfect for travel; I am no longer afraid of losing chargers!
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: This does have a shorter cord so I had to lay the phone on the floor instead of putting it on my nightstand but for some reason we keep losing chargers and these were a fair price. As the picture shows the cord is a detachable USB which I like because I can use the cord for other things too! You get what you pay for here! The charger works great!
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: when it works, its great. but then it dies and stops functioning for no reason after about 6 months. I went through 4 of these, and all the same issues. now just a nice usb cord, but not a wall charger anymore.
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: This charger came with my Droid Bionic when I bought it new last December(2011). The usb cable is excellent and is one of only two usb cables I have for my Droid that can be used for data transfers such as file transfers and tethering to the internet through usb. The charger on the otherhand worked wonderfully for the last 10 months, quickly charging my phone and keeping it charged despite heavy use watching movies through hdmi and tethering/wifi hotspot use. Other chargers I have just cant keep up and seem to get hot. However, to my surprise this charger suddenly quit working the other night. It was surprising because I have never abused this charger, it rarely leaves the home and has never been exposed to any weather or water. Luckily my Droid will charge good enough for me to get by. I'm using my computer usb and other micro usb chargers I have until I can find a good replacement. I am extremely disappointed with this Motorola charger though.
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: The reason why we can get this real Motorola brand charger at this price is because it's not packaged for retail sale. reviewText: The charger and the cord are truly OEM Motorola products  They are constructed well, and work very well,  The charger will work with any device of any termination, although the cord is designed for micro-USB devices.

reviewText: We lost our Nook charger (original Nook, not color), and after reading up, I found that they just need a micro-USB charger for them to charge.  This charger worked like a charm.  By the time we got it, the Nook was thoroughly dead, so it took about 2.5 - 3 hours to charge, but it fully charged and everything is working great now.Can't complain, especially for the price.As a follow up, this also works for the Galaxy S2.  The rating on this charger is about 850mA, which results in a slightly faster charge than the stock 700mA Samsung charger, without any harm to the battery.  The great thing about this is so many devices use Micro-B USB now, so this charger has a bunch of uses.  And if you have another USB item in the same amperage range, you can use the base from this with the other USB cord.
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: This is a USB phone charger, so there's not a whole lot to say about it.  If you're using it to charge a phone any cheap charger is probably fine. My advice to you is you make sure you order it from Amazon or a highly rated seller if you want to get the genuine product.  I have ordered three of these, all shipped directly through Amazon, and all three have worked perfectly with the Raspberry Pi.  I can only assume anyone complaining that these did not work with the Raspberry Pi ordered from sub-par vendors who sold you a sub-par product.

reviewText: I've purchased several chargers now as a back up to leave at work for my phone. After getting a few knock offs claiming to be OEM I decided to do some testing. Got a device to test voltage and amperage from chargers. This charger actually puts out the advertised voltage and amperage. Most chargers from amazon are cheap and will put out the correct voltage but usually put only around 200-300 mA when they are advertised to output around 1 or 2 Amps This one I believe was rated for around 800 mA and it actually puts out 800 mA. Excellent. That means it is much faster at charging your device than a usb port would be. Buy this charger. It's the only one that works well. Trust me!
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: I purchased these from Bargain Cell for my Droid X.  They are identical in every way including output ratings of 5.1v === 850mA.  The part number for the cable is SKN5004A while the charger's is SPN5504A.  These are exactly the same as what came in my Droid X box.As any Droid X owner knows, the Droid X gulps battery power and you can't have enough chargers.  I also happen to have a thermoplastic polyurethane (TPU) case for my DX.  Unfortunately, the thicker cable ports on my long micro USB cables do not insert flush inside the micro USB port of my DX. However, the Motorola OEM cable ends are very thin and therefore plug in more easily and stay plugged in.  This is why I only sought out chargers and cables that were Motorola OEM.Keep in mind that the cable is short.  This works well when charging from a counter top location but terrible if you're running the charger from the ground to the top of a desk.  In that case, you can always useUSB extension cables, which is what I'm doing with one of the 4 chargers I have.  Lastly, Bargain Cell shipped the charger quickly and I received it on the same day as a charger I ordered at the same time from Amazon using 2-day shipping.
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: I purchased the Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger with my Plantronics M50 bluetooth because the advertisement stated that the two were "often purchased together."  First of all, the Plantronics M50 comes with its own charger.  Further, the Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger does NOT fit the Plantronics M50!  Therefore, I do not know why anyone would buy the two together when they do not work together!  Thus, the advertisement is deceptive.  However, the Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger does incidentally fit my Samsung Galaxy SII smartphone quite well.  Thus, I kept the charger as a backup.  Otherwise, do not buy this charger unless you are sure that it fits the device for which you are searching.

reviewText: I was happy to find this at such a cheap price, but of course it was not Motorola brand, and instead some knock off from another country.  It still worked fine after opening it, but slowly began to become finicky with the positioning of the wire.  I would have to have it sit a certain way and eventually it just stopped altogether.  The plug still works for other usb devices but the cord is worthless.  For the price it isn't a bad risk to take, just don't be surprised to find the cord unresponsive one day.
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: Worked like a charm.... for about 35 days.  It was a few days over a month, then it completely died.  Doesn't work anymore.  Had to drive 30 mins to work to go get my alternate charger, so I could use my phone.  If you're going to skimp and buy this knock-off garbage, be careful.  Make sure you always have several on hand.Update: Seller sent a new cable, and all systems has been go.  No problems at all.  In fact, I've since bought another cable, and that one has been good too.  2 out of 3 ain't bad!
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: Charges a dead phone in 30 minutes.  A very powerful charger so once it is charged, remove it from your phone to preserve the life of the battery.  My only issue and it is more of diva issue is that the cord is not that long.  However, with the speed charging of this item, you don't need the long cord.

reviewText: We bought tjis as an extra charger for work.  This charges our Droid Razr and Droid 4 very well.  No complaints with this charger.

reviewText: I have this in my office and am using it with my year-old Motorola Atrix 4G. It works well and charges my device OK. I used some cheaper replacements that did not charge or had cables/connectors that were not good fits.I am not sure if this is a genuine Motorola accessory, but it looks, feels, and works like one. And it is priced far better!
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: This one worked for my phone. It is just like the one I got with my Android phone, so it works great. I wanted this one since my husband got a phone too & took my other charger for his phone.

reviewText: They look, and are labeled like the original charger for the Atrix 4G. I would buy again and recommend to a friend. $7 and with prime arrived in 2 days
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: I needed a spare charger for my HTC Evo Shift.  Since I wanted to avoid both the expensive OEM model, as well as the poorly reviewed generics, this inexpensive Motorola product fit the bill.The power rating of 850ma is modestly lower than the Evo Shift's own 1A charger, but since the output voltage is the same on both, all this means is charging takes slightly longer with this charger.This is the "usual" new design, where the USB-to-microUSB cable detaches from the wall-wart DC adapte; a nice evolution from the old one-piece cables, where you'd need to carry a second USB cable for use with a computer or USB-only charger.  Cable and charger seem reasonably well-made.Recommended.
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: As far as I can tell, this is the same product that came with my phone.  It works well, glad I bought 2 of them so that I can leave one in the office and another in the car.
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: The cord is a little shorter than expected, but I can't complain for what it cost. It charges my phone and that's what I bought it for.
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: So, this works, fits my phone, was cheap, and had free shipping.  Which is about all I care about.  That, and it doesn't lock the phone while charging (some of the older, cheap chargers don't let you use a newer phone while it's being charged--don't know why, but that's just how it is).  I'm glad it has the extra cable so it can go into a computer.  Although hubs and I have the same type of charging port and I swear tons of chargers all over the place, they go bad or we lose them, or we have more devices than we can plug in (my Nook uses the same type of charging port).  So, it's always nice to have an extra on hand.  That's exactly why I bought this, and it works well.  I usually just plug in my phone and charge overnight or use my car charger while using heavy duty apps, so I'm not concerned about the charging speed.
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: I purchased these in June 2011.  It seems that all of the family didn't have enough chargers.  They needed one at this place and one here, one there...  So I bought two or three at a very good price.  These look just like the ones that come with the new phones.  Work like they should, but have the shorter cord.
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: Replacement for a lost LG charger that had mini usb connection.  Works fine and charges a little faster since it supplies 100mA more current than the original LG.  No problems with charging and was less $ to replace.  Came quickly too.
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: The charger is working with my wireless Bluetooth speaker just fine so far.  The voltage output is purported to be  5.1 volts.  I have no reason to doubt that.  The thing charges up my speaker quickly.  The cable that comes with the charger is heavy duty and has a USB plug on one end and a micro USB plug on the other.  That cable works for my speaker quite well.  As it would with any device using a micro USB port for charging.I have been leaving my Bluetooth speaker attached to the charger in the hope that it will not overcharge the battery.  I still do not know if the made in China Motorola charger has an IC chip in it to prevent overcharging. So far, so good.For the price this charger is a bargain, but it has one flaw if it is used while traveling.  The wall plug-in prongs/blades do not retract. That is no big deal I suppose, but I knocked off a star because of it.It occurs to me that many of the somewhat negative reviews for this product suggest it doesn't work because the provided cable doesn't fit their particular device. I don't think that is a criticism of the charger, but only an observation that the cable is not designed for their phone, iPad or whatever.  Frankly, I was surprised to find this charger came with a cable at all.  Many chargers not.
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: Seems to charge my Droid batteries ok.  Difficult sometimes to get the battery placed in in the charger just right so it will charge. Bonus that the cord can be used as another Droid charger without the charger attached.
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: While traveling, this little gadget comes in real handy. It small size can fit pretty much anywhere. Use on numerous products
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: Perfect for exchanging out different usb cords! We charge alot of electronic and found that it save space to just plug in a different usb cell phone hook up.

reviewText: I should have learned my lesson after ordering a "Motorolo Bluetooth Speaker Bag" that wouldn't hold my small EQ7. reviewText: I bought three of these so I'd have extra chargers for my Droid X. Two of out 3 of them work just fine, but for some reason one of them didn't work. reviewText: I bought this to use as a power supply for my Raspberry Pi. It works perfectly. It also appears to be 100% Motorola, and not a knock off. Can't beat it for the price!
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: I needed a replacement charger for my HTC EVO 3D so I purchased this charger on July 27, 2013 from amazon.com not a 3rd party vendor. I ordered this based upon the reviews. When I received it the charger and usb cable appeared to be of good quality. The included usb cable fit perfectly with my cellphone and charged my phone without any problems. The usb cable disconnects from the charger allowing you to use the cable for other things. Right now I'm using the usb cable to charge my phone from the usb port in my computer since the charger plugged into the wall no longer works. If I smell the internals of the usb port from the charger it has that smell of fried electronics. I had it connected to a working surge protector and I am not aware of having any power surges. This seems to be a faulty or cheaply made charger that failed with only 2 months of use. I can no longer return this charger as it's past the 30 day window for returns.
title: Motorola Micro-USB Home and Travel Charger

reviewText: If you buy Motorola, you're buying the name.  And that's a name that stands for quality. Better than cheap throw away cables, and they're all over...

reviewText: It's hard to find a good quality micro-USB cable for under $5.50, and this package comes with a sturdy thick high-quality (yet short) micro-USB cable *and* a genuine Motorola 850mA charger.I have several old Motorola devices that came with this charger, and I can confirm that the chargers I received were the same (or slightly updated) as the previous chargers I owned that definitely came directly from Motorola.I have no complaints. reviewText: i lost my years old 720 at a sporting event.  For me, the 720 had given perfect service.  I am on the phone a lot during the day and wear the headset ALL day. reviewerName: A. A. Glazer "world wide web wanderer"
reviewText: There are newer,better phones on the market, but for $150, the Droid X is remarkable. I had an older HTC and this puts it to shame. The things it can do out of the box is remarkable. Then of course, add a few apps and - wow. Very impressive. Nuts to the naysayers that complain of battery life. That's just the way it is, guys. Big deal. Charge your phone at night and get over it. I bought an extra battery just in case I might need it.As with any smart phone, if you overload the system, it will start to lag. I experimented and ended up uninstalling a few apps right after I put them in. I added a memory manager and it now scrolls ever so smoothly.Also added a case (Otter) because it is not an easy phone to hold - large,(YES!) thin and square. The case makes it easy and protects your investment.Probably the worst thing I can say about the Droid X it is the video recorder. The camera is fine. The the video is vanilla. But again to those naysayers...go get a video camera. This is phone. Stop complaining.Probably the best thing I can say about this phone is that it is NOT an ATT. I wanted better reception - I went with Verizon (PagePlus actually).Love my Droid X!
title: Verizon Motorola Droid X No Contract 1GHz 3G WiFi Camera Android Smartphone
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Cell Phones', 'No-Contract Cell Phones', 'Phones'], ['Sports & Outdoors', 'Fan Shop', 'Cell Phone Accessories']]

reviewText: I think this is my favorite phone I've ever had. I bought a used one a couple months ago and I loved it so much, when my upgrade came up, I chose the X2 over the new Droids and Rzr phones.The X2 cannot compare to the X. It is cheaply made and it worked just like the X. So I ended up returning the X2 and kept the X. The battery cover on the X2 broke of into the phone causing malfunctions.If you are thinking of buying the X2, don't do it. Keep the X you have or buy the X over the X2.It is very fast moving from app to app, fast internet even on 3g, and because of its larger size, the touch keyboard isn't that bad at all and I'm starting to get the hang of it. It is larger than an iPhone but smaller than the Samsung Note.It rarely freezes up or restarts itself. In fact, I can't remember it freezing up one time since I had it. I previously had a Droid2 and Droid2 Global and both would regularly freeze and/or restart itself.I have dropped it twice with a silicone cover and it didn't damage it at all.I highly recommend this phone even over the X2.Here is a cheap case that offers great protection and is easy to take on and off to change battery:OtterBox Commuter Series Hybrid Case for Motorola DROID X 2 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Black
title: Verizon Motorola Droid X No Contract 1GHz 3G WiFi Camera Android Smartphone

reviewText: Since I refuse to be locked into a contract and use Page Plus which is a cheap conduit for getting Verizon. I'm stuck with buying older versions of phones. reviewText: At first, I thought this was an amazing product, but, in the long run, you'll wish for your regular, non-smart phone back.  The processing power on this Droid is so weak that all its capabilities fail to be enjoyed.  Don't count on this phone to record and save photos and videos.  Every once in a while, my pictures and videos become corrupted.  A lot of people say it's just a bad sd, but I've replaced it and this problem persisted.Constantly slow.  Lagging, locking and freezing is what you'll get from this phone.  On my first call, this thing froze and I could make a call.  Seriously, this smartphone couldn't make a simple phone.  I had service and nothing was being working in the background, and the only way to get it to respond was a real hard resent... opening the back panel and remove the battery and put it back.Forget it.  Wait until it's cheaper or get something else.I can assume that's why Motorola release the Droid X2... it's cause the original one was too weak in it's processing.Also, I mentioned tradition.  I know several people with the original Droid and mentioned how quickly the quality diminish.  Not by better, newer technology advancements.  No.  If you Google the problems of the phone, you'll noticed that the smartphone had a deteriating problem for it's cameras.

reviewText: This vehicle dock is meant to work with the Atrix 4g phone, also from Motorola.  As a dedicated accessory to a specific product, it pairs very well with the Atrix phone.The car dock comes with a small insert that allows you to use your phone with it regardless of whether or not you have a case.  Some bulky cases might prevent you from docking successfully, but small form factor ones should work without a problem.  If you have no case or cover, the insert lets your phone slip snugly into the dock.  The insert sits in the dock itself, it doesn't have to be attached to your phone.  You wouldn't even know it was there after your 1st use.The suction cup is very well designed and attached firmly to my windshield.  I've had problems in the past with docks not sticking to my window, especially in very hot or very cold conditions, but this dock holds tight and doesn't so much as wobble.  Also included is a small 'cup' for attaching this to your dashboard.  I prefer the window mount, but you can attach to your dashboard if you like.The cord included plugs into a car power adapter (also included) and into the AUX port in your vehicle.  The power adapter has 2 USB ports on it, meaning you can charge another device while this one is plugged in, a great feature.  If you do not have an aux or input in your vehicle (or stereo) you might want to review your options for getting sound from the atrix to your car, but the phone will still charge, and you can always just turn the speaker way up.  I found I had no problem hearing navigation commands or calls over the phone speaker on high volume.When the phone is plugged in it automatically launches the dedicated cardock app.  This gives you several large icons, easy to hit with one hand.  There are several default ones, and multiple pages of customizable slots where you can add any program you want.  For example, I added Pandora radio app to my front page, as well as the 'camcorder' program.The default 'my location' icon is nice in that it acts as a compass, telling you your current direction.  If you click on 'my location,' though, the interface it launches is not ideal.  I found I had better luck using the google maps 'navigation' app included with the atrix.  When that program launches it offers voice search by default, whereas the 'my location' required you to hit a tiny button in order to do voice navigation.My only complaint with this product is that there was a production run of non-functional car docks.  That is, some docks do nothing when you plug your phone into them, they're not working.  A quick internet search shows that a certain number docks shipped with some kind of defect.  I ended up with one of those units.I was able to get a replacement dock through Motorola, but the process was not as smooth as I would have liked.  At first they wanted me to factory reset my phone, losing all my data.  Next, they wanted me to pay for return shipping (and, indeed, required a credit card number before they would honor my warranty).  In the end they replaced my unit, though it took a while and many many phonecalls.I give this product 4 stars overall.  This is a great great cardock, but it's a bit expensive and Motorola customer service was more of a hassle than they should have been.
title: Motorola Vehicle Dock for Motorola ATRIX 1 4G with Rapid Car Charger - Retail Packaging

reviewText: This product was an excellent addition to my work vehicle and was easy to use and easy to mount too.

reviewText: I'm still rocking the Atrix and decided to get this because the price was right (check the Amazon Warehouse deals, 20 bucks and in perfect working order) and it works very well!  I would almost pay full price for it, especially if my phone wasn't nearly 2 years. old.  Anyway, it was very easy to set up and works perfectly.  If you have AUX input the sound goes through your radio which is very nice.  I love using internet radio or my own music on the road.  The GPS is also pretty nice even though I have a dedicated system.  It's small and I've had no problems yet.It's also a very nice car charger with an extra USB slot to charge something else (something to consider when you factor in the price of this! a cheapo car charger costs at least 5 bucks and I've had them before and this is much better quality).  Bad things - You can't use your case.  I just use a little silicon case so it's not big deal to take if off, but if you had an otterbox or something it wouldn't be ideal to use this.  Also where the phone plugs into the dock it's a little damaged, nothing major but it does give it a few scratches.  Still a nice little system.  I really wish I would have gotten it before!ETA : I ended up freaking loving the GPS on this and how easily you can use it with the car dock.  It's google standard GPS that comes on the phone, but I love that you can use voice commands and the location just pops up and routes you where you need to go.  Yes, you can do all that without the dock, but it's a lot easier to see with the dock and the sound comes loud and clear through your car speakers.  So much better than having to mess with my slow unresponsive TomTom GPS if I need to find multiple places.
title: Motorola Vehicle Dock for Motorola ATRIX 1 4G with Rapid Car Charger - Retail Packaging

reviewText: Extremely happy with this item.  Now I can listen to my phone (music), navigate, or make phone calls all hands free.  Only down side are the power wires, but not enough to lose a star.
title: Motorola Vehicle Dock for Motorola ATRIX 1 4G with Rapid Car Charger - Retail Packaging

reviewText: This car dock is exceptional, with one flaw explained after my rave review.  The USB connection is used for charging as well as giving you a 3.5 mm jack on the tail end to connect to your car stereo.  Doing this with one wire is ideal!  If you decide to put the dock in the top corner of your window and hide the wire around the edges, i.e. the long way, you'll find that the wire is too short and you'll have to add a USB extension cable.  For other locations the wire is the perfect length.  Once connected, the Atrix takes over your car (minus auto pilot).  The Navigation voice comes over the car stereo as well as music.  If you want to have navigation without the voice, simply turn down the volume using the rocker on the phone and your music will play uninterupted.  This is because Navigation, Music and call volume are controled independently. Another nice feature is that if you are not using a bluetooth headset and choose to make/take a call, the phone defaults to speaker phone and if you choose to turn speaker phone off during the call, it diverts to the car stereo.  A very well thought out set of features to properly integrate the phone to your car.  So why only 4 stars... as of my writing this on 4/20/11 there is an issue with charging performance in the car dock.  I'm using the OEM Motorola ECOMOTO Rapid Rate vehicle power adapter (850 mAH) with dual USB ports. You can tell this USB charger is a good product just by the weight of the thing! A test charge began at 7:45 AM and the phone's charge was 20%. At 9 AM 30% and 10:30 AM 40%. This is obviously nothing like the wall charger so it makes me believe that the phone is powered by the charger while docked plus receiving a trickle charge.  Conneting the phone directly to the USB car charger (without the car dock) using a stock USB to micro USB charging cable, at 8:00 AM the phone was at 20%, 8:20 AM 40%, 9:00 AM 70% and 10:00 AM 100%. What a contrast!! So there is an issue with charing performance while in the car dock. I'll be reporting this to Motorola and would expect them to address with a firmware update on the Atrix phone or a recall on the dock, depending how they device their solution.  You can say you read it here first as from what I know, this has not been reported on any forums yet.
title: Motorola Vehicle Dock for Motorola ATRIX 1 4G with Rapid Car Charger - Retail Packaging

reviewText: The dock is nice. Using it with PowerAMP makes it a great media player. I'm not going to go super in depth on this review.Pros: The suction cup is great. I don't know how they expected a case to work, cause even without the shim for 'no cases', nothing fits. Mainly because it doesn't make the slot any wider. What is my case, a glued on piece of foam to the back?The 'car dock' app on the phone doesn't look like the one in the picture. It's an ugly one with no glow or anything.Calls are defaulted to speaker, not to audio out of the connection.Disconnecting doesn't send the 'headphone disconnected' signal, so music keeps playing.I like it. It has its quirks, but I like it. Can't say too much else, as my hand has been typing up all these reviews today and is starting to hurt.

reviewText: I have had this dock for about 6 months now. The only problem it has is that programs like Pandora, Music, Navigation do not auto-mute. If you get another program (profile settings) you can set your phone to auto-mute when unplugged.Besides that I was amazed at the way it is integrated into driving, has a dark screen mode for night time. The buttons make for quick access to navigation, Pandora, music, calling via one press contacts buttons. I love how easy it is. With the profile program it solved my problem with auto mute. If you have it plugged into your aux stereo port you have to hit the speaker button to take it off speaker to use the car speaker system to hear the caller louder that the phone's speakerphone.The best part about buying it on Amazon is that it comes with the two port USB hub. AT&T; makes you buy a separate usb post to plug the wires in that plugs into the cigarette lighter outlet. So amazon has a better deal overall. My wife got the same phone as me and needed one, glad Amazon had it. Shipping only took a couple days.
title: Motorola Vehicle Dock for Motorola ATRIX 1 4G with Rapid Car Charger - Retail Packaging

reviewText: I felt like I was getting scammed paying as much as I did for this car dock, but I feel a little better after having it in hand. I called 4 different ATT retailers, no one had this in stock so I finally just called upon Amazon.This kit actually comes with a decent amount of goodies:(1) 12V DC adapter with dual USB outlets(1) male to male speaker cable with one right angle(1) USB adapter with female speaker outlet (this plugs into the dock and charger, plus has the speaker out so you don't have to mess with a second cable to the phone for audio)(1) docking station (with either suction or sticky mount)(1) docking station shim (good planning on Motorola's part here, they understand you may have this in a case, if you don't, use the shim so it doesn't wobble around)This actually works really well. I have had no issues with poor suction. The phone goes in and out nicely than any others I have seen and this is a lot cleaner looking than the after-market ones that just clamp it in. Made to fit almost makes this worth the price. I was worried that I would have to dock the phone, and then plug in the audio cable, not so! Just leave the Audio/USB cable plugged in to your AUX in and you are good to go. Excellent design.4 stars instead of 5 because of the price.
title: Motorola Vehicle Dock for Motorola ATRIX 1 4G with Rapid Car Charger - Retail Packaging

reviewText: **Edit** Just got my Otterbox commuter (2 days early, Thanks Amazon) and unfortunately it does NOT fit in the vehicle dock. I was hoping it would be close enough so I could make some "modifications" but I don't think it's possible. There are port covers for the USB + HDMI when opened, need to flip backwards. My first idea was to cut those off but then I realized how much thicker the phone really was, The back of the phone gets double protection and sets the phone way to far forward for usb connections to line up. Even though this dock is built to accommodate the Atrix + case, I can only see ultra-thin cases working with this dock.I like this dock. It's easy to use, well designed, and adds some great new features to driving. Although I have never used a high-quality GPS unit, the Dock + Atrix gives me lots of new techy tools I'm not use to having in the car. The standard driving application (launched automatically when its docked) gives all the practical features you would ever want such as access to music, maps, GPS, hands-free calling, etc. You can even add/delete apps which is a great feature since I hate devices that add a lot of bloat I would never use anyways. If you search the App store there tons of great apps for driving as well such as tracking gas mileage, cheapest gas stations, repair costs, taking pictures/video, Pandora, and the great part about it is most of these apps are FREE...Back to the dock now. I use mine windshield mounted in my Subaru Outback and its sits at just the right height/angle. The included pieces which come with this dock have a great build quality as well. The included USB+ 3.5 audio input jack (yes the usb cable AND 3.5 audio jack are built into one cable which splits out at the end) are high quality and was long enough to route down the backside of my dashboard and wrap around to the cigarette lighter which means all I see is one cable disappear into a vent (actually a small opening between the defroster vent and the dash, and then re-appear next to the cigarette lighter. This dock also includes a very high quality cigarette lighter to DUAL USB adapter. This means you have an extra USB port for charging your ______. I normally stick to HTC products but Motorola is really pulling through. Can't wait to see what else they come out with next.Pros:*High Quality Build*High Quality accessories (USB cable, 12vdc to dual USB charger)*Easy to use*Easy to put on and take offCons:*Price. To me 39.99 sounds like the target price for this thing. $50+ is a bit steep and why it only gets 4 stars.*Doesn't look like many cases will fit with this dock. Even though it has a removable trim piece to accommodate cases, I don't think any Otterbox product will fit on this thing as well as any other cases more than 1-2mm thick. Waiting for my Commuter case to arrive this week and I'll update if it does indeed fit.
title: Motorola Vehicle Dock for Motorola ATRIX 1 4G with Rapid Car Charger - Retail Packaging

reviewText: I was trying to wait and get the HDMI dock, when I saw it for a good price. Well, someone in the Motorola forums mentioned this was on sale for under $25. reviewText: I got this to replace the large digital grey alarm clock that would brightly display the current time (and keeping up at night!). Given the short battery span of this phones, it surely served it purpose by inserting it and charge it all the while displaying the current time and if you would like see stuff on it you could do that as well. Since it's the Standard Dock, it's only meant for charging and plugging it into some external speakers. I bought this so it could act as my alarm clock on a stand and when it's time to go I just get it off and out the door! Although there is the Multimedia Dock (and extra price included) I feel I'm better off with this accessory since when it is to time to sleep I can lock the phone (it still does have a small LED light that blinks) and be satisfied with it.Pros:Charges your phoneIt is set to display your clock or show your app screenCan set to show the current time and can be set up as the alarm beside your bed or deskCan be plugged to external speakersCons:You need to take off any cases protecting your phone before you can insert itOnly 2 ports, one for charging and one for external speakers. That's it.Its loose so you can easily pull outAlarm clock or app screen and then it's basically a cellphone stand

reviewText: I ordered 3 of these so I could have one bed-side, one at the office, and one at my desk at home.  Turns out the Atrix 2 does not fit the dock for 2 reasons:1. The phone is larger than the dock.  The top plate of the dock is removable, but does not fit even with the plate removed.2. The USB jack on the dock is flipped over compared to the phone (180 degrees out of phase).Further on-line research reveales that Motorola does not offer a 'Standard dock' for the Atrix 2.  I can go with the 'ATRIX 2 HD Station', but that's $100 :(I'm offering these comments for others to be aware.  3 stars is not indicative of product quality or performance, since I did not actually get a chance to test the dock.

reviewText: Motorola's Command ONE is a solid, functional, useful and sometimes fun to use product and it has what it takes to, possibly, stand out in the crowded and fiercely competitive field of Bluetooth headsets. I will start by discussing its features grouped into several distinct categories. I marked a feature with a + when happy, - when not happy and = when in between or indifferent.COMFORT+ LIGHT WEIGHT - as in 'not heavy'. I had the ONE continuously attached to my ear for a couple of hours and I didn't experience any significant discomfort. In fact, when not in use I was barely aware of its existence.+ 5 GEL COVERS - they are easy to change and try out.+ EAR HOOK - can be set to use with either left or right ear.+ NOISE CANCELLATION - not bad at all. Tested in a noisy office and street environment and I was happy with the results.= CALL QUALITY - again, better then most. Heard slight hisses and echoes but only occasionally. Call recipients had no complaints.DESIGN (ERGONOMICS)+ JAWBONE-like SHAPE - about 2 inches long, follows the face curvature.- CALL BUTTON at the back, right 'on' the USB charging port is small and hard to get to when the ONE is in ear.= ON/OFF slider switch, on one side could have been done better.+ VOLUME and MUTE BUTTONS are on the other side, relatively easy to reachFEATURES AND CAPABILITIES+ EASY PAIRING - with up to 2 devices simultaneously+ VOICE COMMANDS - can pick up a call by simply saying 'answer' or... not by saying 'ignore' when prompted. Easy voice-based setup.+ VOICE DIALING - will recognize names in your phone book, even ask you to specify if you have more than one number for the same person (cell, home, office)+ CALLER ID - will say who is calling before prompting you to either answer or ignore the incoming call.= MOTOSPEAK APP, a little buggy, compatible with Android and some Blackberries - reads incoming text messages and even lets you respond via text by speaking your reply.+ 4 HOURS TALK TIME (about) on a full charge, several days on standby.+ USB MICRO PORT for charging. Was able to charge it with Kindle's and a Blackberry's and it should work with most 'third party' chargers.= ENCASED BATTERY - can't be replaced.CONTENTS AND WARRANTY* COMMAND ONE Bluetooth device as discussed above.* EAR HOOK* 5 GEL COVERS* CHARGER* MANUAL (English, Spanish, French)* MOTOSPEAK PAMPHLET, explaining how to get it for an Android phone or Blackberry* ONE YEAR WARRANTY - phone numbers are provided, which is a good thing.EVALUATIONHoping not to repeat myself too much, these are the positives: I am happy with the way this headset feels in my ear - as in I'm hardly aware of it when not in a call. The almost hands-free operation and the good noise cancellation make it ideal for use in a car, especially when you're not driving alone and you don't feel like piping your conversation through the speakers. Its ability to stay connected to TWO devices makes it good in an office environment. I found the sound quality to be adequate and I can say the same for its ability to function on one charge for up to 4 hours.On the negative side, I did NOT like the placement of the 'call' button. You don't need to touch it on an incoming call but you need to press it to originate a call or to initiate any voice conversation with the device (voice dialing). The button is too small and, in my view, misplaced at the 'near ear' end of the set. The other semi-disappointment is the MotoSpeak app which was difficult to install on a Blackberry Bold and appears to be a 'work in progress' at this time - but I don't rely much on texting so I can't say that I'd be using MotoSpeak if it were better.A properly placed TALK button would have made the Command ONE a 5-star because I would have loved it. The way it is, I still 'like' it and, therefore, 4 stars are well earned.-->> Brush your teeth, it's the law! <<
title: Motorola CommandOne Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging

reviewText: The Commandone has amazing call quality, seriously. It took me a over a week to adjust my speaking voice of not having to speak "UP" for others to hear me. I was nearly at a whisper several times and the person on the other end said I sounded fine. Another selling point is comfort. Usually, it's in my ear from 3 pm to around 10 or so without any break and I barely noticed, if at all, that is was there until I was alerted for an incoming call. The range is great as well, I've left my phone on the first floor of my home and roamed to the second without any breakups. I could recommended it for ease of use and comfort, but the call quality is the true selling point.
title: Motorola CommandOne Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging

reviewText: 4 STARS, this is great. Excellent fit over the ear & reception. Definitely worth $30 or more. Crystal clear, no complaints! :-)

Problem is that it turns off after 15 minutes and growls in a rhythmic pattern.  Sound on phone kicks in loud and I end up with a loud growl in my ear. reviewText: I'm a everyday bicyclist the Command One allow me to answer incoming calls, answer text messages and listen to my music while still having both hands on the handle bars. The double mic system makes it easy to hear and for other to hear me. I love it and I depend on it to communicate while still being safe.

reviewText: One of the most important attributes for a headset is comfort. I've tried a few over the years, but always have found them to be a pain (literally!) if they are worn for more than 20 minutes or so. I'm very happy to report that the Moto is a dream when it comes to comfort - had it on for a three+ hour drive, and didn't even know it was there. Plus, it didn't cause a problem with my glasses, unlike other models I've tried.Set up was very straightforward - basically just follow the prompts and it works. I didn't try out the text-to-voice feature but it sounds interesting. Not really something I would use since I don't text much at all, but if you're text-heavy, that feature would certainly be of value.Audio quality was excellent. Had no problems hearing callers even with music playing in the car. Range was also very good.My complaints are two-fold. First a minor one - this comes packed in what I would consider to be wasteful packaging. Looks impressive in a clear, thick plastic box, but the amount of materials used for packing is unnecessary. I did not, however, deduct anything from its rating due to that.What did cause a loss of one star was the mic pickup. In a quiet environment it was fine. But, in a noisy environment (such as outside, in a crowded restaurant or with moderate-level music playing in the car), it picks up so much background noise that people had problems hearing me. To ensure this was actually the case, I loaned it to a friend and had him call me so I could hear for myself. It seems that the mic is either way too sensitive or not sufficiently directional - it truly is hard to hear the person's voice when they are using the headset should they be in anything other than a pretty quiet environment..But, that aside, this is the best headset I've used to date. Especially recommended if you have had comfort issues with other headsets or are a glasses wearer.
title: Motorola CommandOne Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging

reviewText: wish they had a ear piece that fits into the ear canal a little better, tried all the ones that came with this headset and find myself constantly trying to adjust it so that I can hear people talking
title: Motorola CommandOne Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging
