title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I will compare this bluetooth to the Plantronics M25 and M50:Why it's better than the M25 and M50:Good range. The M25 has serious range issuesAnnounces number of callerHas a "ding" when call begins and ends - very important to me!Has several different hook and earbud options so you'll probably find something that fits you.Stays in my ear better with just the earbud - doesnt fall out if you rotate the earbud a bit so that it's snug in your earIt has + and - volume buttons!The light flashes all different colors for different meanings like battery, charging, connecting, etc.Why it's not better than the M25 and M50:Only 9 hours of talk time compared to 11 of the M25 and M50 (Although in actuality it seems like they are about the same)Only has low, medium, or high battery status, and not in hours of talk time like the M25Hurts my ear with just the earbud when I wear it for longer than an hour (even after daily use for almost 2 months)Looks funny when I wear it. The M25 looks so nice and slick and small. The HX550 sticks out of my ear with the square look and the weird looking boom. I do not look business-like with it on...More expensive
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: In my opinion, this bluetooth outperforms many costing much more.  I bought it for myself initially after my previous one starting having problems holding a charge.  Once my girlfriend saw all that it does and tried it she had to have one.  Since then several people in my office and one of my good friends bought one as well and it is universally loved.  The sound is very good, the volume is loud enough for all but the loudest situations, the pairing was fast/simple, the range is exceptional, the battery life is impressive and the charge time is unbelievable.  15 minutes on a charger for a full charge!If there is a down-side, the earpiece options are excellent, however the soft rubber ear inserts are a bit fragile.  I tore mine removing it from my pocket so be careful with those.  If anyone knows where to get replacements please comment on my review.  If I find them I'll post it later as an edit. It still works, but probably needs to be replaced before it tears any more.One other note on the ear inserts: if you use the either of the ear loops you need to use the donut-shaped ear insert that comes with it.  It is removable and you can move it to either loop.  If you don't use it, it will tend to fall off and the volume will be too low because it doesn't bring the sound into your ear canal without it.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: Great bluetooth headset. Clear, crips sound quality. Great features and by far the best headset I've purchased. If you're looking for a bluetooth headset look not further this is the right one for you.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I'm probably like many others here, who love the wireless freedom of a Bluetooth headset so much that we continue to buy the newest units hoping that one day, someone will make a headset that sounds as good as talking directly into the phone. I have a drawer full of discarded bluetooth headsets. In the last few years I've had a Plantronics, two Jawbones (ICON and ERA), and most recently - this unit. I'm sad to say, that while this unit is marginally better than the ERA, I still have to switch to the handset to clearly hear the caller, and for the caller to clearly hear me in noisy environments. The unit works fine in a quiet environment; but if there's any significant background noise (driving with the window open; walking down a busy street), it is difficult for me to hear the caller, and when I switch to the handset, the callers always claim that the sound is much better.I'm sure part of it is my 50+ hearing, and some of it may be the bluetooth on my Galaxy Nexus.  I've had this headset for about a year. It's fine for listening to podcasts, or having conversations in relatively quiet environment (walking the dog at night on a quiet street is fine; but walking near a busy street renders it unusable. It's the best I've found thus far; but I'm sure there's better out there. I would love it if someone could suggest a unit that they've found to be as good as a wired headset.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: Well made ear piece, works much better than I thought it would and i love the way it talks to you
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: This has become my go-to headset for making/receiving calls and also listening to podcasts. It has a great range and never looses connection as long as I am within 30 ft. of my phone. The sound quality is as good as my more expensive Plantronics headsets. Operation could not be simpler, flip out the microphone boom and it is on. It will announce that it is connected and if the battery level is low medium or high. There is a rocker volume switch on the top and a large call receiving button on the side. Battery life is very good and it recharges very quickly. What I really love about the HX550 is it is so small; the earpiece is 1 5/8" closed and 2 1/8" when opened. It is so light I barely notice I am wearing it.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewerName: D. Deutsch "Chance favors the prepared mind."
reviewText: I found that this bluetooth worked very well-until I lost it. It was small, light, and less obnoxious looking than some other units I have worn. The sound was pretty good, but as with other mini-bluetooth headsets the voice recognition commands were loosely interpreted by the iphone. How an attempt to call my mother resulted in the playback of Sergeant Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band is something that I will never understand.All these features contribute to its other great quality which is...invisibility. This unit is so small it is prone to getting lost. At this point in the game, I feel that it went to the Land of the Lost Left Socks. So enjoy the HX550, it works great, but keep it away from your socks. You never know when they'll decide to elope.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: This is a compact headset that feels fine on the ear, is very lightweight, and has good sound quality.When in use, there's no noticable drop in quality (other than the usual cell phone interference, etc). It's just as clear as when you're using the built-in mic and speaker -- maybe even more so, since the sound is right in your ear.It was very easy to use, though if you pair it with an older BlueTooth phone some of the features may not work as expected.Battery life is perfectly decent.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: This is a very nice headset for me. It stays on, I can hear well and have had no complaints from others regarding poor call quality. I use the ear loop and do wish there were more ear bud sizes to choose from. From what I've been able to figure out the ear bud assortment are options only when you don't use the ear loop. The ear piece that works with the loop sits on top of the ear and I prefer in-the-ear. Bluetooth set up was amazingly fast and automatic.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I've used a lot of bluetooth headsets over the years, some good, some bad.  This one is easy to use, has decent features and great battery life.Pros:-Easy to turn on and off - just slide the boom closed.  This saves battery, which is crucial for a headset.-Long battery life - several hours talk and a few days overall, with a spoken battery level on power on.-Multiple wearing options - can combine hook and ear bud or remove one or the other.-Quick and easy pairing.-Excellent audio quality and great noise cancellation-Very reasonable priceCons:-Short warranty (one year).  Most of my headsets don't even last that long, but we'll see how durability goes for this one.-Loud snapping sound when closing boom can be irritating.-Beeps when muted, a lot.Overall I found this headset to be excellent and a great deal.  Recommended for anyone needing a bluetooth headset.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: The sound quality and battery life on this unit are excellent. It has A2DP so it plays music or other audio through the headset although naturally in mono. I can listen to audiobooks from my phone and the sound is clear and loud. The noise rejection is amazing. I can jog or drive in my convertible with the top down and the wind noise is minimal. With a wired headset the other party says it sounds like I'm in a hurricane. In a LOUD restaurant with plenty of background noise the person on the other end barely hears anything in the background. The background noise rejection is simply amazing.It has a voice recognition program for Android called Motospeak. The voice recognition gets a F grade as the voice recognition rarely gets the words right but there are other settings in the app that are useful such as reading out text messages.The one drawback is the advertised 300ft range is NOT 300ft. It goes no further than any standard bluetooth headset. I'm not sure why they advertise it as 300ft and not the true 30ft. It's hard to believe Motorola made a typo so I have to consider it deliberate deception.I've read other reviews where others have commented on the range and their experience is identical to mine. I've read no comments on anyone getting more than the standard bluetooth range.I would buy this headset again but some could buy it for the 300ft range in which case it's false advertising. If it stated the true 30ft range, I would give this unit five stars.The range is really no big deal, you won't be 300ft or even 20ft away from your headset usually but false advertising is false advertising and that one factor could be the factor that makes someone choose this headset.UPDATE: I've done some research on 300ft bluetooth headsets and I have updated my review and my rating to five stars. Motorola is not exactly lying, they just aren't telling you the whole truth.If you have a phone with a Class 1 radio then it will transmit to 300ft. The problem is that as of September 2012 there are NO phones with Class 1 radios in them. So as of now, NO phones will go the advertised 300ft.The bottom line is that given the choice I would prefer the 33ft(10m) over the 300ft(100m) range simply because the power output is 40 times less and I prefer to have as little radiated power as possible going into my head.The following table compares the available Bluetooth power classes. These are POWER classes, NOT Bluetooth device or version classes.Class Maximum Power Operating RangeClass 1 100mW (20dBm) 100 metersClass 2 2.5mW (4dBm) 10 metersClass 3 1mW (0dBm) 1 meterIf you wish to communicate over the 100m range, you will need a class 1 Bluetooth device at both ends.If you wish to communicate over the 10m range, you can have a class 1 or class 2 device at both ends.Many people make the mistake of believing that they can extend the range of their class 2 device to 100m by purchasing a class 1 device for the other end. This is simply not true. Consider two people standing 100m apart, if person A yells loud enough for their voice to travel over 100m, person B will be able to hear what person A is saying, but if when person B replies they only yell loud enough for their voice to travel over 10m, person A will obviously not hear the response.Thus is the case with the HX550. It technically will go 300ft with a Class 1 phone. There just are no Class 1 phones at the moment and even if there were, I don't want 40 times the power output going into my head just to go a few more feet. So given the new info AND since rarely will my phone and headset be more than 30ft apart, the existing 30ft range is just fine.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: Easy to set up, calls are very clear, they hear me perfect on the other end, can listen to any media through them (music, phone alerts/sounds,etc), light and compact, very comfortable, quick to switch from one ear to the other, super long battery life, looks good... simply nails every requirement I had for a bluetooth headset.I exclusively answer and make calls through this headset. This includes my 12-16 hour shifts when I keep it on pretty much the whole time with sporadic short calls and it never becomes uncomfortable throughout, in fact its easy to forget that I have it on, then at the end of the shift the battery is still 'high'. Ive used it for longer calls but never heard it say anything but 'battery is high'. I still charge it about every 2-3 days or so just in case.The over-the-ear hook is no good at all, but the in-ear gel is very nice (and doesn't plug the ear canal).
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: Nice little headset. Sticks fairly well in your ear. Very loud. Voiceprompt tells you battery level. Flip piece shuts off headset so you don't have to turn Bluetooth off on phone. Has a long range, I can leave the phone in a tractor cab or vehicle and walk 50 feet away and it won't disconnect. You get used to it being in your ear you forget its there. Doesn't really block surrounding noises either, so its not like it plugs your ear so you can talk to someone in person while wearing it and it doesn't effect their voice. Was worth every penny.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I work from home and I am on conference calls the whole day with colleagues and clients.  So I needed a Headset that will let me be heard but will suppress the noise of the TV from my daughters room or helicopters flying overhead. I have tried many different brands and models.  Plantronics was very reliable and clear, but did not suppress the background noise very well.  But this HX550 really reduces the background noise considerably. I have used it in the Supermarket, the car and even in the Mall. The people I was speaking to did not have any problems hearing me, and they said that they can hear some faint sounds in the background but was not distracting at all.I hope that it is as durable as it is functional.  I will update this review again in a month or so you will know if it still works.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I've had a lot of bluetooth headsets and this one ranks among the best yet. It's so small and lightweight that I forget I'm wearing it. reviewText: After 2 months of use I'm happy this headset with one caveat. It doesn't handle less than a full battery very well. The pairing was simple and the control intuitive. The inclusion of 3 different earpiece set-ups was also very nice. I was able to try various configurations without having to buy the different parts. The sound from music and phone calls is great at all times on my end and the noise cancelling microphone has received much appreciation from folks on the other end of the line.However, they also notice (easily) when my battery is getting low. Apparently the quality of the connection from the headset to the phone is reduced tremendously as the battery loses power, needing to be within a few inches of each other towards the end of the battery. The unfortunate part is that only the other person can tell there is a poor connection. What sounds fine to me sounds like heavy wind to the other person when the battery is low (even if I'm sitting in a quiet room). I'm happy enough to keep this and give a positive rating but I have to charge it after every 3 or so hours of talk time.This case fits the headset very well for glove box or console storage.Bluecell Black bluetooth handsfree headsets HARD EVA Case/Bag for Jawbone ERA ICON HD & ICON + Bluecell Cable Tie
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: very good audio and noise cancellation.This is the smallest/cheapest (well, cost/quality ratio) that has has noise cancelation with two microphones.Only downside is that i use it for work meetings, where i have to press mute several times. And it only have two volume up/down buttons. you mute by pressing both at the same time, and then sound cuts the call to inform you about the mute state. and there is not way to check mute after a long time into the call other than talking or pressing the two buttons twice to hear the muted/unmuted sounds (and loosing important call information)if they had used the microphone boom switch to enable/disable mute, it would be much, much easier and you could check the state with a touch of the hand very easily as well. But instead, closing the mic boom turns the thing off.I'm not using the phone mute button. which completely undermines all the advantages of having a wireless headset. i could use the wired ones with the same comfort (not to mention not having to worry about batteries)
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I hate holding a phone in my hand, so I'm a long-time user of bluetooth earpieces from a variety of manufacturers at a wide range of price-points. This is the best one I've used in terms of sound quality, ease of use, Siri integration, and battery life. So why only 4 stars, you ask? Well... when I first got this earpiece, I was using iPhone 4s running iOS 6.0. The HX550 paired and worked flawlessly. I upgraded to the iPhone 5 and all that went away. On phone calls lasting longer than about 2 minutes, the HX550 would make a click sound and disconnect. I resigned to writing off my beloved HX550 as a lost cause. As I thought about it, I wondered if the fact that since I had originally connected my HX550 to my iPhone 4s AFTER I had updated iOS and it worked fine, if doing the same on the iPhone would work. When I first got the iPhone 5, I immediately connected the HX550 BEFORE updating iOS (and it didn't work). So, I wiped my phone clean and restored to original factory settings. Then, I updated iOS. Then, I paired the HX550. After about a week of heavy use and long phone calls, the HX550 has not done the "click/disconnect" thing. I'm happy that I was able to salvage the HX550.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: The ear hook on this headset is very comfortable. Compared to my Jawbone Icon, I feel like I can wear the ear hook longer than 2 hours without feeling a pinch on the top of my ear. reviewText: To keep it concise, it's a good headset, but I had to use the Plantronics Explorer 395 to alleviate the muffled sounds on the iPhone 5. I also didn't care much for the earloop (too tight to put on quickly), or the earpiece (the earbud style just doesn't give me clear sounds), or the A2DP controls (it tends to take over other iPhone sounds, like email, keyboard clicks, etc.), and the flip design is a bit geeky, and unneeded.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I would give this headset 5 stars for fit, comfort and sound quality.  It's wonderfully adaptable to different ear types, easy to switch from one ear to another and voice and music sound great on it.  Battery life is also very good, giving me a full day of music listening and recharging quickly.  The only issue I've had with the headset is the range, which is GREATLY affected by obstacles.  The biggest issue is the My Motospeak app that it uses.I have a Droid Razr.  My Motospeak has never worked well.  It responds to text messages only intermittently, and most of the time I have to manually deal with the text in one way or another (including the fact that my phone does not register that the text has been read by the app and I have to actually read the text to turn off the reminder).  This negates the entire purpose of using this 'hands-free' app.  The speech recognition is really poor, and I can't rely upon it to send an accurate text most of the time.  It doesn't recognize 2 out of 3 names when it comes to voice dialing, and while it can read out the contact name when I receive a text msg., for some reason it can't do it for incoming calls and will only say the phone number.  Slowly.  So that by the time I can decide if I'm going to answer the call, it's already gone to voicemail.  I purchased the Motorola bluetooth specifically so that it would work with my Droid phone seamlessly, but with this ineffectual app it's not living up to it's potential :(  Even though the app is a separate item, it's an integral part of making this bluetooth perform as advertised.Update:  I've figured out that I can uninstall the My MotoSpeak app and just use Droid's Voice Commands to perform many of the tasks for the headset.  There are other apps as well that I will try so that I can get the best experience possible out of this unit.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I found this HX-550 device to be uncomfortable, difficult to fit in/over my ear and difficult to turn on/off due to poor design.The over-the-ear mounts didn't work well for me at all.  The smaller in-the-ear mount worked better.However, I originally thought that the on/off control via the flip stem would be a good idea.  Unfortunately, in use it did not work very well for me at all.  Making the flip action unfold from the inside of the device (the part that is against your face/ear) was not a good choice.  There is minimal clearance when you are wearing the device.  So my big fingers with minimal nails could not easily find the end and open the stem w/o pulling the device out of my ear.WHY put the flip action from the inside out, rather than the more logical from the outside down?  Or make the stem rotate from the top of the device down to fully deployed.  Either would make more sense!During use, if I wanted to open this small flip stem to take/make a call w/o having the device come out of my ear, I had to use two hands - one to wiggle my fat finger between the device and my face to search for the stem end (up near the inside middle of the device) and the other hand to hold the device in my ear so it wasn't pulled out when I folded the stem out.  Using two hands to enable the device is obviously not practicable when driving.As for the sound, my friends said I sounded OK and background noise was eliminated nicely.  But everyone sounded a bit muffled to me, as if the high end frequencies were being dampened too much..Why don't these devices have some sort of tuning ability to allow one to determine the overall frequency response characteristics?I would recommend caution when looking at this or any similar devices that have an on/off/microphone stem that flips open/closed to the inside of the device (against your face).
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: Like the sound clarity. Can hear other parties clearly. Others indicated that they could hear my clearly, even while driving on high ways. So noice cancellation is working as advertised. Like the small size, too.Mute function is welcomed but not practical to use while the headset is on ear. Motospeak application crashes on my Android phone (T mobile mytouch 4G).
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: First off, I ordered the "RETAIL" version of this and it did come in a sealed generic box labeled "Data Connectivity Kit", but inside was unit that was a factory refurbished unit.  I did not get any of the accessories.  Yes, I know there are different sellers and etc, and I won't knock the seller by name since Amazon gave me a credit.  I do have to remove a star for that alone because Amazon and Motorola should know what a retail box looks like and ensure that the end user receives what he is supposed to.  If your sales channel is not robust, then customers are not happy.Beyond that, I have to remove two stars for the flip out part of the device.  Quite simply, it is a joke.  You are already dealing with a small device, so trying to reach up and pull this out while it is attached to your ear is just not practical.  If you have small fingers and sharp nails, then it might be OK.  Opening with one hand was impossible for me.  So major design flaw in my opinion.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: Drop it in my purse or pocket, phone clipped to my waist, and there's nothing more convenient for talking. Texting and messaging through Siri works pretty good also. Works great, there is something to note on this little unit, no fault of the manufacturer. After completing a call make sure you hang it up by pressing the middle button firmly, then flip the mic up. If you end the call through just the Bluetooth device by depressing the middle button it won't necessarily have made the connection to hang up. If the mic is then flipped up your other party, if still connected on their end, can hear you. I still give it 5 stars, have had this for two years now and the charge on it lasts forever. A recording informs you of your battery level once activated with your phone. Highly recommend for anyone on the go looking for reliability in a Bluetooth device.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I had a Plantronics Voyager 510 a few years back. The sound quality - at both ends - was superb. However, for me comfort was an issue [the thick earpiece on the Voyager caused pressure on my close-to-my-head ears.] So, I got a Motorola H15. Great comfort with the slim earpice and light weight - horrendous sound quality at both ends. I gave up on bluetooth headsets for one year. Then, I saw the reviews on the Motorola HX550 both on Amazon and websites that reviewed newly released products. This one is lightweight, comfortable and has superb sound quality at both ends. It truly has great noise cancelling: I've told my friends I was on a headset and they thought I was talking directly from the phone. It has a great range: I can leave my phone turned on in the car, go into a store for a few hundred feet, and still be connected. If the connection gets lost, a recorded voice says the headset is disconnected. With compatible phones, it responds to voice commands like "answer, call ..., etc." The battery life is unbelievable. Upon each fire up, a voice tells you if the battery power is high, medium, low. They only weakness I've noted: I wish the ear piece held the phone a bit more securely to the ear. That's the only reason I didn't give this a "five." I found the ear bud attachment, a provided option, even worse. I have had the headset occasionally fall off. However, even though the phone feels like it's just "floating in air" and not firmly attached, the voice quality is still top notch. So, perhaps it's just me. Oh, forgot to mention, this headset is sooooooo lightweight you can easily forget that you have it on. That can be a plus or a minus depending upon your preference. This is hands-down the best bluetooth headset I've had and at a very reasonable price.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: After using 5 different Bluetooth headsets in last 8 years, I finally found "The Best".Motorola got this so right that for the first time, I think i have found a product where each feature is excellent and works as described by the manufacturer. What I love about this:- Super cool flip-open. No need to press power button.- Sleek design, looks stylish- Very good noise cancellation(Standing near an airport while there was a plane landing and the caller on the other kept talking normally without realizing the loud noise)\- Voice recorded announcements for incoming calls, battery level, and device connection status- Can connect to 2 devices at the same time(iPhone and iPad..ideal for Skype, FaceTime etc.)- 3 different adjustments for mounting..There is nothing wrong with this headset and I am sure it will stay as bestseller for a long time.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I've been using this Bluetooth earpiece for about two weeks now, and it's absolutely brilliant. The clarity is stellar, and in fact even when I'm driving in the car, I don't tell people I'm on the Bluetooth until I've been talking for a while. They're always shocked. If I were to lose it tomorrow, I would buy another one immediately.Pros:-- Very small, so when I'm wearing it, my hair can cover it so people don't even necessarily notice.-- Different earpiece options, which is so important. I hate those ones that go behind the ear. The option that goes inside my ear fits perfectly, and I never worry about it falling out.-- Easy to turn on and off by just flipping the mic open and closed-- Works with iPhone's Siri feature perfectly!-- Battery life is incredible. And when I say incredible, I mean you could easily go 5 to 6 hours of listening to audio and making occasional calls without running out of battery. It recharges quickly as well.Cons:-- No case is included. I'm paranoid about losing it because it's so small, so I put it in a little case I had laying around, and attached a long ribbon to it. Using the ribboned case makes the Bluetooth easier to find when I'm not using it.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I was so happy with the first HX550 that after 4 months I lost it so I bought another. The only problem I had with the first one is the boom mic was very sensitive. Also the push button on the side was hard to push but it was light weight plus I was always impressed with Motorola, and I have a Moto RAZR. The second one I had the boom mic fell apart in pieces and Amazon said I had to buy a new one. So I bought a new for $39 and it arrived BROKEN and guess what part? Yes you guessed right the boom MIC!! All I wanted was an exchange and they gave me a refund. NOW THE SAME EAR PIECE $46 bucks.  I've been a Amazon shopper for a long time but I think I will start shopping around.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I happen to only like Motorola headsets that have that closeable boom microphone... to me, that's the best feature to turn it off or turn it on QUICKLY! I really like this bluetooth headset, but I keep loosing these things because they're so small. hehe. My only complaint with this headset is that whenever there is noise on the other person's side of the phone (whether it be background noise, traffic in the background, or the other person talking or just making noise), it cancels out anything on my side. So, the other person misses a lot of what I say unless I cup my hand over the microphone and talk really loudly so that I come through louder and clearer than any noise coming from their side.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: This product is only a little short of amazing. I am giving it one star, because of a problem that needs to be fixed. (NOTE: Problems now fixed with OS upgrade and workaround. See 2nd update below.)Clarity - 5 stars: Everyone I have talked to has said that the clarity of the HX550 is excellent whether on the road or in the office.Ease of use - 5 stars: The My MotoSpeak application as well as the earpiece itself provide an excellent user experience and are very easy to use.Voice recognition - 5 stars: The voice recognition is nearly perfect in catching every word and translating voice to text.Voice calling - 5 stars: Whether saying, "Call Nancy Mobile 1" or "Call 651-555-1212," calling using voice commands couldn't be easier or more reliable.Voice texting - (Now 5 stars. See update below.) 1 star: The application beautifully converts voiced messages to text, and equally amazingly reads text messages that come in while using the bluetooth earpiece. These features are lifesavers for someone who is on the road a lot. Unfortunately though, the My MotoSpeak application does not allow the messaging applications on Samsung Galaxy S3 and Samsung Galaxy Exhilarate phones to acknowledge the messages as sent. As a result, the messages eventually show up as failed in the messaging applications that come with these phones (even though in most cases the messages do indeed go through). So unfortunately, I am unable to use this wonderful feature.Motorola has outdone themselves with this outstanding reasonably priced bluetooth earpiece. I will happily change this review from one star to five stars as soon as Motorola fixes the voiced text message acknowledgement issue. Despite the issue, I am keeping the HX550 because the functions that do work are excellent and because I'm hopeful that Motorola will fix the issue with Samsung messaging applications. (I have called and informed Motorola support of the issue.)12/7/2012 Update: I have completely given up using this product for work. The MotoSpeak app fires off the Samsung music player at the conclusion of every call I make. I'm very disappointed that Motorola is not interested in correcting their software for use with Samsung devices. I guess they're only concerned with Motorola devices. 1 star.12/30/2012 Update: I just updated my Galaxy S3 to the Jelly Bean operating system and the voice texting now works perfectly. Instead of using MotoSpeak, the earpiece uses Samsung S Voice to send text messages. Voice recognition is still spot on perfect (amazing!). The only slight drawback is that it no longer reads voice text messages back to you before sending. But the voice recognition is so good that it's really not necessary. It did not make a single error during my testing.With regard to the problem of music playing after dialing phone numbers rather than using listings already in the phone, the Jelly Bean update did NOT correct that problem. However, I was able to do a work around by deleting all my music from the phone. Now that the music is gone, the HX550 now operates properly in all ways and I can use it for work. I am very happy about that because nearly all the functionality of this product is perfect. Sacrificing my music from the phone is not that big a deal because the purpose of the phone is for work.I'm leaving the 1 star review so that other Galaxy S3 owners know what they're getting into. But with the music work around, I feel that THIS IS A FIVE STAR PRODUCT. It is now one of my favorite tools for work.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I hate in-car phone systems. It galls me that the NTSB could back a faulty study and recommend sole use of in-car systems. Why insist on increased background noise (distracting?) and zero backup? More Good Government, right?I keep three ear-sets --- one primary in the car, along with an older backup. (I've been using headsets since waaaay before hands-free was required. Call it a dumb pilot's habit. NTSB?) I keep one in the house, since I find it a pain becoming an "instant amputee" when the phone rings. (And people who speakerphone their way around fifteen feet from their phones gall me, too.) Having just had one hand in a cast for two months, I can make a strong case for my crummy attitude. ;)So, now that I've gotten that off my chest, how do I REALLY feel?This unit --- especially for the price --- is taking my prize, so far.Comfortable? I charged it for a half hour, put it on, and forgot it was there for the next four hours. Incredibly lightweight, excellent loop-to-ear tension, positive, ratcheting adjustment. Great sound, in and out. Lots of features. Charges FAST. And it got here FAST.I've been using an EtyBlu2 in the car. Great item, if you like the sound-blocking ear approach. Terrific noise-blocking, with the boom mike. My wife and I have both gone the Jawbone route: cumbersome, difficult to keep oriented properly. This one not only sounds better --- it's half the price.I got one of these for home use. My wife gobbled it up a few minutes after getting home. So, I ordered another one.Sound recognition --- especially of voice --- can be wildly different for folks. My hearing tests "perfect;" my wife's does not. So my perception might not be the same as everyone else's --- but it's a good bet Motorola understands that.My very first "guy at the traffic light asks you about it" BlueTooth ear-set was a Motorola. This is light years beyond. Seems that someone was listening and went for engineering, not just design.It almost seems creepy, but this might replace the Ety as the primary. It's really very, very good.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I evaluate bluetooth headsets based on 5 key characteristics: Reception, Battery life, Sound, Ergonomics and Aesthetic. The Motorola HX550 makes very well in the first three and not too well in the last two. I used it several hours every weekday listening music for about 8 months until it started showing some problems that I will describe below.-Reception: 5 Stars. This is the best feature of this headset. It received the signal from the cell phone at about a dozen yards with no interruption in the middle of factory plant. There were no walls in between, but a lot of electromagnetic signals from machines, computers, other bluetooth headsets, etc.-Battery life: 4 Stars. As advertised, the battery lasted 8 hours (+- 10 or 20 minutes) of continuous use. It took about 50 minutes to charge it completely. There other headsets with 11 hours battery, but they sacrifice sound quality and reception.-Sound: 4 Stars. The volume level and tone balance is high and clear enough. This headset has a very good noise cancelation, which makes easier for your party to understand you when talking in high ambient noise. Other headsets have better tone balance.-Ergonomics: 2 Stars. It's too heavy, even for an ear accustomed to hold earphones. At first, you won't feel any discomfort, but after several hours of use you can feel some pain until you get used to it. The ear buds provided were too big for me. Anyways, they can't be smaller because they wouldn't hold the headset on the right position (toward your face). Also, the idea of a swivel power switch wasn't very smart. It makes it hard to turn on and off the headset while it's in your ear. You have to do it sometimes if you need to save battery or after a non-successful pairing (not frequent). You will hear a sharp click right on your ear when the swivel hits the body of the headset to turn it off.Aesthetic: 3 Stars. The design makes it look bulky. I don't think it would be the preferred choice for a lady paying attention to elegance. I think that they probably had to make room for a powerful battery, antenna and hardware, but the exterior design suffered a lot.Conclusion: As said before, the reason for getting rid of this headset was a speaker problem that showed up at about 8 months of intense use. Every time that I turned it on, the speaker started working intermittently. I had to restart it several times for the speaker to work well. However, the problem came back randomly while using the headset. I still would recommend this product with some warnings. Nevertheless, if you can, buy another brand.Hope this review was helpful and that find a nice headset. Good luck!
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: This is a very nice unit.  It was a snap to set up.  And if your caller hasn't blocked their number you get the phone number of who is calling you read to you before you answer. Much better than hunting for a button.The volume buttons were easy to use.  And the mute feature (pushing both volume buttons at once) was confirmed with a tone.  A nice feature.All in all this is one of my favorites headsets now.  I have so many I can't keep track of them.  But this is a definite keeper and one I will use often.

reviewText: I am new to "bluetooth," and I purchased this item as a replacement for a less expensive unit I also bought from Amazon not too long ago. The flip-on/off feature is great, and the duration of the battery is about four times that of the replaced headset. I especially like the comfort of the "on ear" arrangement.  All in all, I believe that this is one of the best purchases I've made on Amazon.  I have seen the issues in other reviews about reliability and durability, and I'll update this review if I experience any of those (hopefully not). reviewText: This headset is a perfect complement to my smartphone and helps make it smarter.  The earhook that comes attached to the headset when you purchase it works great keeping the bluetooth on your ear.  It's so comfortable that you forget you have it on.  The sound is great in most conditions, though I have gotten some complaints if I am walking on a very windy day that the sound is a little bad.  I can hear callers very clearly, and my music comes through very well also.  The MotoSpeak app which allows you to speak and hear text messages is great for hearing them but the app has some lag when trying to speak back to it.  Most phones have built in voice recognition now and that may work better than the app does.  But to me, that in no way diminishes the usefulness of the headset.  Also, the white color, to me, makes it easier to locate than the traditional black headsets.  I've lost many headsets in my day, but this one stands out much more so I haven't had a problem locating it (knock on wood, LOL).  I strongly recommend this purchase to others looking for a quality, durable, comfortable headset that has clear reception and is easy to learn and use.

reviewText: I have a Blue Ant, a newer Plantronics, an older Motorola model as well, but all are trumped by this outstanding bluetooth headset.  Let's get down to the key points:-It's small, well-made, and easy to use with good buttons-It pairs beautifully with my Android phone (HTC Evo Shift, Sprint)-Battery life is excellent-Voice quality is excellent with impressive filtering of background noiseSo, at baseline, this is an excellent device, worthy of consideration.  But what sets it apart?-A2DP capability means that you can listen to music or media over your headset--a very nice feature missing from most of the older headsets.-MOTOSPEAK: a free app from the Android market (no iPhone app yet, I think) that will--wait for it--READ YOU YOUR TEXT MESSAGES ALOUD and then allow you to SPEAK YOUR RESPONSES!!  This is pretty amazing and something of a game changer!  While there may be similar programs out there that do this, I cannot stress how neat this felt.  You just hear it speak in your ear: "New text message from Frank Pikowski... Don't forget to bring the cables, see you soon"  And then you can simply reply with your voice and it will transcribe and send it.  I feel like this will be something that we'll see on the iPhone 5 or 6 and is generally the way of the future... but this brings it to you now.It also has a few other neat features that make it a cut above:-A neat little arm that "flips" open when you want to turn it on and flips closed to turn it off: this is such an elegant and ergonomic way to do this-A HIGHLY customizable in-ear or over-ear setup for attaching it to you (I rather like the default over ear setup)Bottom line: A superlative bluetooth headset that does the basic tasks beautifully but has a few extras that make it worth a close look.  Highly recommended.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: Motorola HX550 looks great! Works great! Sounds Great! Pairs super easily, and has an excellent background noise cancellation using the dual microphones along with the Crystal Talk (tm) technology.The included ear options works very well for my ears and I am sure it will be fine for most users as you have on your ear, in-ear with an ear hook or in-ear without a hook.I love the automated voice guidance given during pairing; I have not heard this feature in any other Bluetooth device before, it makes pairing simple and fast for anyone. The automated female voice also lets you know the battery level without having you to look at the LED light to find the battery level.The buttons are placed in appropriate places for volume and love the POWER FLIP- Motorola's  unique "Rapid Connect" feature lets you handle calls with just a flip. Simply flip open to turn on and talk, flip closed to turn off and save power. It is better than ON/OFF switch and looks cool. When folded, the HX550 is even smaller than expected.It is lightweight and very comfortable to wear. Did I mention the Voice and call quality is excellent? - I tried it at work in very noisy Datacenter Server Room and also in my old Ford Car driving at freeway speed, the party on the other side of the line was able to hear me clearly and I was able to hear the party loud and clear - I am truly impressed by this product's voice quality! - Excellent!FYI, I do not have an Android phone to try the voice to text and vice versa feature using "MotoSpeak" App to dictate texts hands-free and to hear texts read through your headset but even without that App when paired with my aging Nokia 6085 and Samsung Eternity cell phones Voice quality results were excellent which made me a happy camper!Highly recommended! - Using hands free device while you are driving is a Law in most states, Get one! and please drive safely!
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I received this headset the other day and it looks great and seems to operate great, HOWEVER everyone I talked to experienced a very annoying echo of their own voice that I could not hear. I tried the headset with multiple phones and still experienced the problem,.A factory reset did not help. Motorola support could not help. I returned the item to Amazon and have ordered a new one. I am confident it was a faulty device (let's hope), so I will update my review once I have tested the 2nd one when it comes in.Update (Long Overdue):I did eventually receive a second headset from a different supplier. Unfortunately upon opening the packaging I noticed the headset did not look new - which is was marked as. It came in a very generic box, but after checking with Motorola, they said there was no packaging like that - not even OEM. So at that point I just got fed up with my experience trying to get this headset and did not even test the USED one. I just returned it and went to a store to buy one. However, they did not carry this headset, so I ended up with a Plantronics 165 which I have been using for several months now and really enjoy. I am sorry I could not offer a final verdict on this HX550 headset, but sometimes enough is enough.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I purchased this unit to replace my old Plantronics Voyager 510 which finally broke after many years. I am mildly hearing impaired, so I need a Bluetooth headset that delivers crisp, clear, accurate audio to the ear. Any distortion and I'm lost and have to have the caller repeat what they've said, frustrating both them and me. I'm also on the phone several hours a day for my job and so comfort and long battery life are a must. I am happy to report the HX550 meets or exceeds all my needs:- Using the on-ear configuration (it also comes with an in-ear configuration if you prefer), I have worn the HX550 for 7 hours straight with no discomfort.- The hX550 is quite loud and I can run it at a reduced volume even with my hearing loss- The battery supports at least 7 hours of talk time (they claim up to 9)- The audio to the ear is clear and without distortion- The audio pickup of my voice is clear and natural sounding to my callers (I've asked)
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: Love the headset. Battery lasts a long time and charges quickly.  The physical on/off switch is easy to flip and I do not ever want one without it again. Stays in my ear great with a small in-ear loop, pops in and out easily.  Been happy with the sound quality.  No trouble pairing.  I have a white and a black (bulk packaging).  Both are fine.  In keep them off and just open them when I need to make or receive a call.  Just takes a few rings to pair up to answer.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: The sound is great whether talking or listening to music, but it's an uncomfortable little rascal.  I tried all the different ear pieces and they were either too small, too big, uncomfortable or fell out of my ear.  So I chose the lesser of the evils, I use the uncomfortable one.  The quality is good enough that I put up with the discomfort and take it out unless I'm talking or listening to music.  One great feature is how quickly it connects.  Flip it open and you're connected (actually it connects the call but you can't actually talk or hear the other person for about 2 seconds).
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I think the Headset functionality is great.  It's super light and people that I've asked have heard me very clearly, even while driving with the windows down.  If it fit me better, it'd get a 5-star rating.  Neither of the 2 "over-the-ear" holders that came with the headset held the device near my head.  It would just hang out in space and felt and looked strange.  Also, the "in ear" holders begin to feel uncomfortable after a couple of hours.  (I get and make a lot of calls, so I tend to wear the headset all day.)I may be returning the device, but believe it is more a factor of the shape of my ears than a device issue.  The headset was delivered on time, packaged well, and provides very clear calling and reception.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: Works great. I use it while driving my diesel truck and there are no issues of people not able to hear me or me them. Haven't tried the various ways to wear it. Just use the over the ear piece. It stays on firmly and never falls off. A little concerned with breaking the microphone tab when opening, but I just have to remember to open it when I'm not wearing it which gives you better control.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I am overall happy with the quality of sound on this and also it's light weight and comfortable. I will recommend this product.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: This is a very nice headset.  It paired and set up more easily than any other headset I have ever had.  I like the multiple earpiece options and found it to be very comfortable.  Although it's smaller and lighter, it's not quite as comfortable as my Plantronics Voyager Pro+.  The audio quality is quite good although, again, I don't think the noise filtering is quite as good as my preferred Plantronics headset. I do like the flip open on/off switch, particularly handy for those times when you're going to be in standby (off) mode for a long time but you want the headset accessible. The significant advantage that this one has over the Plantronics headset is that it is very small and discrete.  I have an Android phone and listen to a lot of streaming news and podcasts so I will never get a headset again without A2DP. This one works very well and again, the sound quality is excellent.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: This is a great Bluetooth, it has superior distance, i can go outside of my house withing a 30 foot radius and this will continue to communicate with the phone. I have found that the ear piece is a bit large and the ones without the hook are tough to keep in place, would hope that they come out with a small in the part that goes in the ear.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: Pros:  It's simple and the flip helps turn it on and off compared with other competitor slider switches.  It's simple and easy to charge.  Feels comfortable on the ear.  Price is right.  Can hook up to two phones at the same time.Cons:  Flicking the microphone on or off while it's on your ear can split your ear drum with the loud click that it makes.  Not loud enough, seems I can never turn it up loud enough to hear people in the car.  Drops the bluetooth connection on and off calls when I've got it connected to my Galaxy Note II and a older Motorola flip phone simultaneously.  I use my PLT_M50 Plantronics mostly over this device cause I think it's louder.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I had a jawbone headset but managed to lose it. That wasn't a problem till my work commute doubled and I was spending 1 hour a day in Atlanta traffic. So after searching reviews and not wanting to spend $100+ again on a headset I chose this model.Pros:Compact design, Device it light weight, It stays in my ear without fear of falling out, a huge plus as I've had that issues in the past.Can connect to 2 devices simultaneously, another plus as I have work and personal phones.Battery life is amazing.Operation is dead simple.Cons:- Pairing: Connecting to the phone takes a very long time. Sometimes you think it just wont connect at all, then suddenly it connects. Pairing with 2 phones takes even longer, up to 2 min from turning it on. I'm not talking about the initial pairing, this is after you have that all set. Pairing with a computer was one of the most frustrating things I have ever experienced. I wanted to use it for a Skype call and I was getting dropped and reconnected constantly, so much so I turned it off and had to use the computers built in speakers and mic for the call. Far from private and very annoying.- Voice Quality: people complain about the background noise. This is supposed to be noise canceling, my 3+ year older Jawbone did a much better job then this unit.Overall:For the price its not a terrible device. If you plan to use it infrequently then it should do just fine. If you are hoping to take advantage of the multi pairing or computer use then be prepared to be frustrated.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I have owned dozens of BT headsets over the years including some of the most expensive ones.  I have used the HX550 for several months now and believe its one of the best since it offers some unique features.Pros:1. Very fast pairing (Rapidconnect TM) with a nice flip mechanism. This is a key feature since you don't need to keep this headset on all the time.  You can flip it open when the phone rings and it answers the call for you.  This means the battery life is the longest amongst any of the other headsets I have had (several days).2. Solid build quality including the flip mechanism.  I can say this about pretty much every Motorola product I have owned.  That's why I am so looking forward to what Google/Motorola phone!3. This is a class 1 bluetooth headset. What that means is it has a long range (way more than the standard 30 feet).4. Nice secure fit in the ear without the over the ear clip.Cons:1. Average sound quality2. No smart features such as the one on Plantronics where it recognizes whether the headset is in your ear or not3. Motospeak app is below average.In short, this is a solid bluetooth headset with some unique features. Sound quality could be better..But for the cost, you can't go wrong..
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: ** UPDATE **It died... the speaker would cut-out so I couldn't hear the caller but the mic continued to work . (my other BT headsets work fine).  May get another one looking to see what else is available.I have tried the Jawbone (original, Icon, Era), Plantronics (Discovery 925 & 975, Voyager Pro, Pro HD, Marque M155, M100), Sound ID (forget the model, Motorola (H17, H12) and many many more - Only the Jawbone Icon worked well but they (yes plural) would break within 6 mos by generating an irritating sound my callers would hear (sounded like loud rushing wind).  After having done Aliph Jawbone returns twice (not the easiest company to deal with) I gave up on the Jawbone line in search for something else.I spent many many hours over days trying to find the bluetooth headset that:* would NOT cut my voice off, make it sound like a robot or muffled* have good sounding clear loud speaker (I have some hearing loss)* A2DP - I can stream audio, listen to podcasts, nav directions, etc.* excellent noise cancellation (I drive a Honda Fit - not a quite car ride)I believe the Motorola HX550 is a winner. It just works and works well (iPhone 4S).  My only complaint is that Siri's voice is really loud and there is no way that I have found to reduce the volume of her announcements (had this problem with the Marque M155 as well).I was really skeptical of buying this unit because:* I never thought Motorola made good BT headsets* it was only ~$50 deliveredHowever, the Moto HX550 really delivers and the fit is very secure and comfortable.  I didn't think I would like the folding mic boom but it is really convenient for stowing and doubles as power switch for the unit.  It pairs fast and connects in less the 2 secs (from off) with my iPhone.  Thinking of actually using it while I exercise as an option to have wireless music (yes it sounds that good and loud - no bass of course).I would not hesitate in recommending this to anyone at any price range!
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: This is our third bluetooth headset and it is the best so far. I compare it with others in the same price range, not the high-end products that sell for over $100.  Audio is clear and it links to my iPhone easily.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: i own plantronics ，Samsung ，but this Motorola hx 550 is extra light ，comfortable，and it last 8 1/2 hours listening radio without  stop ， so i rate  5 stars  and recommended .
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: As the title says....BUT I drive A LOT for work and have 2 cell phones. It hooks up with both of them at the same time automatically when they're in range. It holds a charge very well, but I don't talk on it a ton. It fits very comfortable in my ear and I love the fact that it's small because I think they just look goofy in general, then again I said the same thing about crocs and now I own a pair and love them.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I brought this blue tooth head set on Nov, 2011, I have use it on 3 phones that I have updated to. I started out using it on the HTC g2 and now I'm using it on the galaxy note 3 on each phone this devise has worked great. I use it at work to to stream music 5 hours a day and I can use it for 2 days on one charge, sound is good. After 2 years of use 5 days a week for 5 hours a day it is still working great.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: Not much more to say, you can hear your call clearly, the hook over the ear keeps you from having to adjust it or hope it doesn't fall out of your ear.  All and all a really good product.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: Their app, and software is a huge part of this device and is mostly left out for iPhone users...I bought this for my Father who is a huge businessman, and travels around the world. He didn't even want it, and said he already owned one which he never used. (Not this model, but a different one)So...not only does the product not support everyone...my father didn't even care to take a free item. So I returned it without even opening the box.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: Battery life is great on this headset. I don't know the exact amount of time but I use it several time a week and it will last weeks before a charge. Sound is decent for the price. Not as good as some higher end devices but it allows me to move within several rooms and still be clear. As others have mentioned the having the talking piece snap back while in the ear can be loud. So I usually take it out to close it.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: It sounds great, the bluetooth connection is strong, the flip-open-to-answer use model is awesome, and generally it works great, except when it's broken or won't charge. Oh yeah, and the voice prompts are quite spiffy.Mine was new in Jan 2012. After a month or two of use, the little part that flips open basically fell off and stopped working. Motorola sent a replacement under warranty, which worked for about a year. Now, the replacement refuses to charge up. The light does not flash and attempts to reset the device have failed with various chargers.It's a fabulous earpiece, and I can absolutely recommend it if you get one for free, or if you're the type of person who has to have a new earpiece every 6 months to stay with the current fashion trends. Otherwise, look for a reliable brand.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I really love this Motorola Bluetooth Headset.  The quality is great and it's easy to use.  You have several different options as to how you can wear the headset.  Anybody should be able to find an option to satisfy them.  It's very easy to change from one ear to the other and to switch out the earpiece that you want.  It's easy to set up and you even have a little voice in the headset telling you what you need to do and it'll give you the status of the battery as well.  The battery life seems to be really great.  I've used it for several hours at a time and it's yet to die on me.  I would highly recommend this bluetooth headset.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black, I've been a headset guy for years, I was one of the first people that wore the wired ones when they came out, long story short, I find moto to have the best headsets, voice recognition, commands, over all I find them to be great, sure moto has had a couple of bad ones here and there but most times they are great, this one I find for my use (lots of voice commands/use) is great, only problem I had was it losing bt connection to the phone, I found disabling its ability to connect to 2 different devices helped a lot with that, but other than that, its solid IMHO.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I have never liked this type of headset, they remind me of those Borg implants on Star Trek the Next Generation.  However, they are great for taking calls while driving (although I have pretty much stopped doing that) or when talking on the phone while doing stuff around the house.  Still, I refuse to be one of those guys at the airport who look like they are walking around while talking to themselves.This headset is very comfortable and easy to use, I have actually forgotten that I had it on until a call came in and really startled me.  I can keep my phone in it's belt-case and it still works fine.  It's battery seems to hold enough power for my needs and the reception is clear. It's amazing how the prices have come down on these!  As far as I am concerned, this one is a winner.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I have a Motorola H17 and bought this because of the touted noise cancellation.The two look and act similar, and it's possible that the HX550 is an updated version of the H17.This headset works about the same as the H17 does.  It doesn't do a lot to cancel noise, especially wind, and like most Bluetooth lower-end sets, it doesn't play well with Android devices.  It's a bit better than the barebones sets and not as good as some of the higher-end ones.Note that with HTC Sense (specifically the Rezound) Android phones, pushing the call button will:1) NOT IN CALL: This will bring up the HTC voice command menu, from where you can ask the phone to do various things as "call auto repair at work".2) IN CALL: Disconnects.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: By far the best bluetooth headset I've tried. I'm using it with my iphone4.It is recognized instantly.The sound is flawless.It's very comfortable.It's lightweight.The battery lasts an extremely long time.I would definitely recommend this unit. It's blows the competition away.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I have paired this with both and iPhone and Android devices. Never a syncing problem.Pros:No syncing issuesGet about 3 days on one chargeStays paired at a good distance from deviceFolding mouthpiece makes it clear when device is on or offGreat call volume/clarityCons:Fit it okay, but not the best. Especially for long periods.Overall, this is one of the nicest headsets I've used, and would recommend it without hesitation.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: This is the most comfortable bluetooth headset I have used. I don't like anything sticking in my ear and one of the three optional earpieces for this headset is on-ear with the other two being in-the-ear. Plus it's very light and easy to pair and operate.But, I don't like it! With the on-the-ear earpiece anyway, if there is any noise at all on my end or the other end, people cannot hear me unless I speak loudly.  Plus, even when turned all the way up, the volume is too low unless I press the thing against my ear, and even then it's difficult to hear if there is any noise. I have a lot of other bluetooth headsets, including the excellent H730, another on-the-ear Motorola headset, and never had a problem with being able to hear or be heard until I had this one.And one other thing I don't like is that you can't pause and restart audio media when using the headset as you can with any stereo bluetooth headset.If anyone can recommend an on-the-ear (single ear) headset with sufficient volume and start/stop media capability, please do so!
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: Purchesed for my wife. Works extremely well, great battery life, awsome clip design saves battery and shuts it off without hassle. I would buy for myself but don't have bluetooth phone yet. It is very elegant and light working beautifully with Samsung Galaxy Skyrocket ATT.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I got this unit to replace my other bluetooth headset. My old headset went for short flight out of my truck window (at 70 mph) after it confused my voice commands for the last time. I've been using this headset in my truck for a while now (paired with a Bionic), and it works great with voice commands. I've had no pairing issues, but then I've never had pairing issues with any bluetooth headset. This unit has a few different ways to wear it - an ear hook, an inside the ear plug and some other device. I've used the hook and the ear plug. I prefer the ear plug, which really surpised me. The on/off on the little mic boom is nice too. Also, when you first turn it on, it gives you the battery status of the headset and confirms connection to your phone. Battery life is great too. I use it only while driving, and have been using it about 34 days. I turn it on and put it on my ear when I get in my truck, as automaticly as I put on my seat belt. It says the battery is at medium. Deffinately worth the money.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: This is among THEE BEST Bluetooth headsets  on the market!  I've tried other Motorola, Plantronics, and Jabra.  This one is the most comfortable, clearest sounding.  Simply to use, I almost want to say "dummy proof" as it TALKS to you, telling you what to do, when to charge, etc.  As long as someone knows how to put something into their ear that is :-) Read on.....Unpacking it took the most time!  I like to wear it over my ear and with the in ear piece, that way it's secure in my ear no matter how much I move.  And two different size "in ear" plastic cups are included.  However you can wear it just in ear, or just over the ear.  And you flip the "over ear" around so you can wear it Left or Right ear.It paired up easy with my phone. A womans voice even talked my way through the pairing. I've had problems with some others bluetooth, but this was easy pairing.The battery was not fully charged (voice tells you) so I charged it for about a half hour.NOTE the AC charger cord is not long, so depending on your setup for charging you may want to use an extension cord.To be honest I did not time my calls, but I only had to recharge it after four days. I wear it in the evening at home doing work around the house and weekends while out.  I can say  it's not every night.You can use it to read text messages.  However I just snap it on when I'm gonna be on the phone a while or need my hands free when talking.It passed the water test and wind test.  People can hear me good if I talk with water running or I'm outside in the wind.  And I can hear them better as their voice increases automatically, then decreases as does the water/wind.This is a high class Bluetooth.  I Highly recommend it.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I've just had this for a couple days. I was torn between this or the Plantronics M50. I went with this one because I have the Motorola H17 and it's great. I wanted one that would stream podcasts from my phone for when I'm at work. The HX550 streams great from my phone (droid inc 2) the sound is clear and plenty loud enough. My problem so far is the sound on calls isn't as good as on my old H17, I'm not sure yet if that's the bluetooth or the fact that my wife insists on turning on the speakerphone every time we talk. She is the only one I have talked to on it so far so if it turns out to be her I will change this to 5 stars.update- I still use this for podcasts but when I shut off them off it drives me nuts, continuously disconnects and every time it does it says phone 2 disconnected battery level is high phone 2 connected battery level is high, After a few times you want to stomp it into the ground. It's not my phone because it doesn't happen with my other headset
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: The bluetooth looks great, and functions great. The noise cancellation is very good and it has a great battery life. It is even better too since you only have to flip the mic down to turn off the bluetooth.With a world of inadequate bluetooths, I say this is the best bang for your buck! Great noise cancellation at a decent price. I'm glad I bought it.
title: Motorola HX550 Universal Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: good quality, quick ship great price. Perfect fit did not have to trim corners. fits great even with the case. No problems and easy to install without bubbles.
title: Motorola Photon 4G MB855 - FIVE 5 Premium Clear LCD Screen Protector Cover Guard Shield Films [AccessoryOne Brand]

reviewText: The cover is good for the price. So far it hasnt given me any problems. Will probably order again. Maybe

The protector surface is too sensitive, I get it scratched in the process of application while using the credit card edge to chase the bubbles out;- Partly for the above reason they don't last long;- Get foggy overtime, sometimes only a very short time after the application.I still give them three stars because of the price point and also because they do perform the basic function they were designed for - protect the screen.

title: Motorola Photon 4G MB855 - FIVE 5 Premium Clear LCD Screen Protector Cover Guard Shield Films [AccessoryOne Brand]

reviewText: I purchased 2 of these batteries at $6.49 each, with a few dollars shipping my total was about $17. I purchased an official Motorola Droid 3 extended battery from Verizon when I first purchased my phone and payed about $40 for it so I was thrilled to get 2 batteries for less than 1/2 that price.When first purchased, these seemed to last much better than my old overused battery and I was easily getting a day and a half before needing a charge again. But after a couple months I am already noticing them not lasting as long and I need to charge by mid or late afternoon most days. I have not had any issues with them getting overheated during heavy use or while charging. Considering how cheap they were, I was not expecting them to be great, so I'm not surprised that they seem to not last like my original one did and I don't regret my purchase.
title: Motorola Droid 3 Extended Battery (BF6X) Motorola XT862 Droid 3

reviewText: Am using this as a back up for my phone,but have tried it to make sure it works and it does the job well.  Would recommend.
title: Motorola Droid 3 Extended Battery (BF6X) Motorola XT862 Droid 3

reviewText: This added some extra battery life compared to the factory battery. I went with this one because I wanted to continue using my rugged case for my phone. Most extended batteries require a different back plate, this one will work with your original back plate but it is a tighter fit. After some time by back plate has worn our and doesn't quite completely fasten any more. But since I have the rugged case on it it isn't noticeable and its worth the extra battery life.
title: Motorola Droid 3 Extended Battery (BF6X) Motorola XT862 Droid 3

reviewText: Great price for an "extended" battery that fits under the stock cover.  It's a tight fit and the cover is a little harder to get on but it's worth the effort to get longer battery life without increasing the size of the phone or risking your warranty on a non-OEM ebay battery.  Good buy for Photon owners.
title: Motorola Droid 3 Extended Battery (BF6X) Motorola XT862 Droid 3

reviewText: Look up the Droid 3 3500 mAh Hyperion Battery. Comes with a new back plate (the battery is larger) to install your new battery. It's a big battery, but it's completely worth it. I used nothing but basic functions (calls and texts) without charging it for a week. Awesome.Hyperion Motorola DROID 3 Global 3500mAh Extended Battery + Back Cover
title: Motorola Droid 3 Extended Battery (BF6X) Motorola XT862 Droid 3

reviewText: Works great. No complaints. The Driod 3 is a battery hog and this helps keep the battery life up all day.
title: Motorola Droid 3 Extended Battery (BF6X) Motorola XT862 Droid 3

reviewText: Excellent for keeping multiple extended batteries charged.  Charges an extended battery in about two hours.  Can fit several batteries and has rubber feet to stay on the table.
title: Motorola Battery Only Charger for BF, HF, BW, and HW Series Batteries - Bulk Packaging - Black

reviewText: I got a couple spare batteries on the cheap from Amazon. I figured for that price it wouldn't be a bad idea to have a them around. Initially when I saw this charger I thought it would be nice to use but wasn't worth the cost. Obviously you can just take your current battery out, put your new one in and charge it in your phone if needed.A few days later I actually ended up breaking part of my micro usb port on my phone. Careful trying to plug those things in the dark late at night forcing when things don't want to go. =)Warranty does not cover physical damage to the phone and instead of doing an insurance claim, paying the deductible and then getting a refurbished phone, this stand alone charger started to look very good. I still say it is overpriced for what it is, but it's exactly what I need. I use it charge my batteries since my usb port is not an option. You have to use the charger that came with your phone or a car charger for your power source. No big deal there. This thing uses the same micro usb port that your phone does.When I first got it, I was surprised to see a cradle on both sides of it. I was excited thinking I could charge two batteries at the same time. You can't. They are different sized as well. While they hold the batteries for my Electrify, the Phonton's twin, very well there is nothing to keep it from falling out if you pick it up and turn it over or on it's side. Normally this is not a problem but if you were using the car charger option for example it might be hard not to have this happen occasionally.  I just put a rubber band around it and the battery won't fall out regardless of the position the base is in. 4 stars is more then adequate considering no charger comes with it and there is no support to keep the battery in place. Those are very minor things. If the cost was cheaper I'd go 5 stars. The product works well and might be just what you need as well.
title: Motorola Battery Only Charger for BF, HF, BW, and HW Series Batteries - Bulk Packaging - Black

reviewText: Basic phone battery charger for extra battery. Works fine, I passed it on to my spouse as I have upgraded my phone. He still uses it.
title: Motorola Battery Only Charger for BF, HF, BW, and HW Series Batteries - Bulk Packaging - Black

reviewText: Two stars is all I could give this product. One reason is because of the way the batteries fit into the charger. There is no retention method so if you bump or otherwise move the charger, the battery will fall out! Not up to the standard I have for Motorola. It's also priced too high considering the quality, fit and the fact that a power adapter to allow it to be plugged into a wall receptacle is not included! I failed to notice that little fact when I ordered it and not just any USB A/C power adapter will work! I had a spare AT&T USB phone charger and it would not work. I have to use the A/C adapter that came with my Motorola phone to charge the battery. Maybe someone in the aftermarket arena will soon supply an alternative to this pathetic little device.
title: Motorola Battery Only Charger for BF, HF, BW, and HW Series Batteries - Bulk Packaging - Black

reviewText: Thrilled when I found this gem that not only charged both my standard Droid Bionic battery and extended battery...but was thrilled to find that it also charged my Droid X battery. Can't charge two batteries at once...but come on...how many batteries does someone need to charge at once? Great that it will plug into the car and the wall charger. Actually seems to charge the batteries at a lower temperature than simply placing them in the phone and charging them (even if the phone is off). Great handy little device! Not entirely the most durable item I've seen from Motorola but it seems to be relatively well constructed. Under normal use I'm sure it would last a very long time. Glad I picked this up
